reviews.review: Best beaches in Cape Town. There are four beaches to choose from 3rd and 4th beaches are hip hop beaches.All the beaches are stunning the only downside is the COLD Atlantic water.

EXPOSED TO A PLETHORA OF NATIONALITIES. Was a stunner of a day, and the beach was packed with bodies of revelers and sun seekers. An iconic beach based on its superb location and proximity to other amenities.

These are stunning beaches, but have some downsides. There are 4 Clifton beaches, each attracts slightly different types of visitors, so research a bit and select one. All are stunning, with white sand, huge rocks, blue blue water and are protected from the wind. This is a big deal in Cape Town where the southeaster blows for most of summer. The southeaster often/mostly exceeds 30 kph and sometimes exceeds 50kph, and for fairly limited periods much higher than that. BUT at almost any time, the Clifton beaches are virtually wind free. Parking is a huge problem, so either get dropped and fetched (uber would work well here) or park early. And expect a fair walk to the beach. There are reasonable facilities on all the beaches, including toilets, chair and umbrella hire at most times. But there is one important downside which may or may not be crucial for you. You really cannot expect to spend much time in the water as it is freezing. Well, almost. Clifton is on the cold Atlantic side and I have been there (in the past - last time I was there I did not even try to swim) when, after lying in the sun for a few hours and getting toasty, roasty and hot, I decided to have a cooling swim. Big mistake. As I walked in, I instantly lost all feeling in my feet, legs; by the time I was about knee deep I had changed my mind about swimming. But dont take my word for it, you try. Just dont equate sunny South Africa and beautiful beaches with warm water. Well not in Cape Town anyway, and definitely not at Clifton or any Atlantic Ocean beaches.

Differences between the four Clifton beaches . Beach "1" is a family beach and dogs without a lead is allowed and the beach area is quite large. As the numbers of the beaches increase the bikini's and swimwear gets smaller. On beach "4" it looks like models and a few yachts were anchored in the bay. No dogs are allowed on this beach. Beach ”4" was definitely the most beautiful one. The beach numbers are clearly marked on street level. Quite a number of stairs down to each one so don't take too many heavy items with you. Vendors come by with cool boxes. On beaches "3 and 4" you can rent a beach umbrella and beach chairs.
Beautiful Beaches. Clifton beaches are so beautiful. We visited on a beautiful sunny day that did justice to the beach. After the beach you can try the cafe's or restaurants for a really special day.

Beautiful place. We spent an afternoon here strolling along. The light was fabulous so my photos look really good. Recommend a stop here even if you don't stay overnight. Very attractive town, beaches shops and cafes.

Beautiful beach. I sayed 10 days in Cape town and I was almost every day on the Clifton beach. I prefer the number one or two because are not tourists at all. The huge stones aroundbmake the bach look amazing, the water is always cold , but the waves make a great show. They have lots of sand, they offer also chair rentals and are guys who walk and sell cool water or juice. Very beautiful beach, highly recomenden!

The water was very cold, so visited only for the view. The water is beautiful blue and clean, however, way too cold in September. We have visited mainly for the view of the bay and the mountains: the location did not disappoint. Also a very safe area in Cape Town.

Ethereal experience. Clifton is the more affluent side of Capetown, across from the Bay hotel this beach is made up of joggers and dog walkers in the morning and has a relaxed very mediterranean feel. The beauty of the beach can be breathtaking especially first thing on a clear morning.
Beautiful Beach!. beautiful white sand beaches surrounded by amazing scenery, it was a wonderful experience and we took lots of pictures.

I"d avoid the Camps Bay beaches. It feels more like the Jersey shore!. Camps Bay is loud and trendy.
Clifton beaches are quiet and relaxing.
We preferred the quiet and I was traveling with my 21 year old daughter!
Beautiful. By far the best beaches in Cape Town. Clifton is absolutely beautiful and the properties there are quite spectacular...definitely a place for the well heeled!!

Beauty. Yup! This is my home town. I'd like to think I'm not bias but I'm not actually convinced myself. Beautiful, beautiful beaches which I'm still waiting for to be beaten. This is the happening spot of Cape Towns beaches. Mother nature rules here and you're pretty far from any commercial restaurants or bars. The closest place is a toilet, if you're lucky. The gods and godess of the mother city grace these beaches. Choose the right one and you might see the cool earthy people of the Cape (there's 4 beaches).TIps:The beaches can be accessed from any part of the central city by public transport " MyCity" bus system. Look for the Clifton route.Take lots of fluid and eats. There's no shops on these beaches and the Capetonians are pretty much laid back, so we eat and drink on the beaches (no alcohol, it against the law to prevent drowning).

Very nice get away from the busy city. Very nice beaches and a very nice walk with many good (but rather pricy) restaurants. PS the water can be (very) cold - depending on the time of the year that you visit.
Chilling. Best beaches in the world.squeaky clean.essy to get to my car or myciti.wster is cold.bodies are hot.

magnificent beaches. These must be among the most beautiful beaches in the world. Sunny, wind- free beaches with pristine white sands and clear blue sea. Wonderful way to while a way a morning or a day. Close to Cape Town and can be reached easily by bus or by walking

Four beautiful beaches. Arguably one of the most famous beach stretches in RSA. Sea cold, beaches warm and friendly. Don't go if you are offended by the sight of some beautiful bare breasted girls from all over the world. The beaches are four in number. Fantastic.
Nice beach, but water is tooooooo cold!. Would be a perfect beach experience except for the fact that the water is ICY cold. nice to lay out on.

Pristine. Coming back to Cape Town wouldn't be the same if you didn't come here. This was a return trip, although it was winter the temperature was very mild for us from Britain. Just had to walk on the beach, then walked across the road to have coffee.Gorgeous beach, so pristine.

Brautiful beach, great shopping. Located at affluent Cliffton area, this beach is rated among one of the top beaches. Sand and gravel laden beach, blue water and mountain cliffs in the backgroud and the picturesque town ship of Cliffton make tbis beach unique and spectacular. Howver, you have to climb up and down since the beach lies at a low level than the township. The area is full of nice but err.. expensive shops, good restaurants and is one of the top tourist attactions at Capetown. Good and must visit place to be included in your Capetown itinirary.
Beautiful!. Great place, amazing view, good restaurants around. Perfect for a bike ride or a stroll. Wonderful sunset!!

The sea view and the beach is nice. That is a nice place to visit,just the terrible noise from traffic and new building 's construction was not pleasant.Around parking areas and restaurants people asking foy money and food
Great Beach. Even though the water was cold this was a perfect spot to take it easy on our two week trip. The boys got into some beach games and just loved every second of it. Highly recommended

Great Beaches but Prefer Camps Bay. Clifton beaches are great. Set amongst some of the most valuable real estate in Africa, the beaches are filled with powder white sand and gorgeous (but cold) waters. But Clifton beaches can get crowded and they are a mission to climb up and down to, so not great for a family. We found Camps Bay much more convenient and offering about the same sand and water (also with a crowd - but at least easy to get in and out).

A beautiful day for freezing water. I live a bit far from Clifton but a trip to the beach is always a pleasure.From the easy access to hiring umbrellas etc, the beach is a friendly place. It is often very clean but can get crowded, especially on public holidays and during holiday season.Be prepared when swimming as the water is very cold even in summer.

Powder like sand!. Dec 27 evening: Our first beach visit in CPT - kids all prepared for a swim. But we were surprised. Though summer, the water was ice cold. The sand was quite soft and powder like. To access the beach, there are many steps down and it can become tiring when climbing up. So, if one has a problem, then it is better to avoid this beach. One can also go to the Camp's Bay beach which is as beautiful. Unfortunately cos of the small hills on the western side, we could not view the sunset. However, it was a pretty sight to look at the eastern side with the houses on the hill side lighted.
clifton beach. the seaside has beauty, the girls and the boys have beauty, the houses are beautiful, the prices are beautifuk

On a nice sunny day get off the Hop On Hop Off bus and walk around. If you are on the Open Top Tour Bus, make sure you take time to get off and walk around the Clifton Beaches area along Victoria Road in Cape Town.

Fun time in the sun. Clean white sand beach. Nice time out for the family. My little girl enjoyed playing on the sand. The water was quite cold but still inviting enough because of the hot sun. It was a good 'hop off' stop from the City sightseeing red bus.
Lovely walk. An absolute must is an early motning stroll on the beachfront. Stop for coffee and watch the locals.

Amazing beach. Bit busy in season, but amazingly beautiful. Try visit out of Dec/Jan holiday season. Great place to relax on the beach, swim in icy cold water on a hot day and even rent SUP for some fun on the water

Pretty private beaches. You can only go up or down the beach in one or two places, otherwise the access is restricted to the visitors. The view in the evening is quite impressive, with houses in the cliffs lighting up and the beach getting all misty.
Gorgeous Beach Town. We were told a lot of the world's rich and famous vacation here in the summer. Reminds me Malibu but with more exotic flare.

A short bus ride on the MyCiti from the centre of town. Four beaches, white sand, very cold sea. My favourite is 4th beach, sheltered from any wind there might be and good showers, toilets and changing run by the life saving club.

Well hidden staircases take you to breat-taking beaches. You clamber down winy, twisting staircases past homes to get to the beach but it's worth the effort. On a clear day it's a great place to chill.
To beach or not to beach!. not for kids.....beautiful people showing off their gymmed bronzed bodies...nice place to be...parking a mission though unless you get in early in the morning

''Lovely beach''. This one is out of this world quite nice sunny with lovely sand and close to main road like Mumbai or Turkey . you feel peacefull and calm walking down the beach . the area is one of the safest in the town even late in the evening. Most of the cricketer stay in around this place. drive on the road is lovely.

Great day trip. This beaches are great for spending the day exploring. There are 4 beaches divided by rocks that you can acces by stairs from the road. The lst beach has facilities and a snack bar but unfortunately they are closed in winter.

best beaches in the world. As locals awe spend alot of time at clifton, amazing beaches, icy cold water with amazing views. There are also activities available such as supping, beach massages etc. Be sure to bring your own water/juice as it is rather pricy to buy there.
Beautiful Place to be at sun set.. Clean, Safe, especialy beautiful at sun set.Bring your own blanket or sun chair, umbrella a must.Stay for the sun and the sand, but DO NOT miss the sun set!

Where you wear your nice bikini and chill out. Spend a good hour or two soaking up the sun, Maybe brave the water if you feel like being daring, super icy in winter and summer. The boulders are good to lie against and read!

Stunning, particularly at sunset. Fantastic beaches, freezing seas.
We stayed in a bungalow near the beach, can see why this is the most expensive real estate in SA. Loungers and brollies available for hire at reasonable prices. Drink vendors can be a nuisance but generally polite enough.

Dream beaches with an icy 8C Atlantic Ocean to cool off in........ Cape Town's trendiest beaches, topless, gay, yuppie and family. The choice is yours. Try a Granadilla Lolly from the vendors but give the icy sea a miss. There are showers scattered along the stretches of white sand .......
Top Beach. Aside from the cold water, this is the prettiest beach I have ever seen. The scenery, food and quaintness make this an amazing beach!!!

Paradise with cold water so there's a better chance of finding parking. As a Capetonian , this is my best place and when I travel this is the place that I miss.Beyond Beautiful. Icy invigorating sea and hot white sands.

Clean and busy - steep stairs. Famous Clifton Beach is a beautiful small beach along Cape Towns coast. It is made up of four beaches. Named Clifton 1st, 2nd, 3rd and 4th. Clifton 4th is the most popular as is it almost cove like. Its clean and safe. In summer you can buy ice creams and cold drinks from vendors on the beach. There are beach showers and bathroom facilities which are very well kept. Great visit to the beach, keep ti clean peeps!

Lovely!. The Clifton Beach area is a really beautiful neighbourhood. The beaches themselves are stunning - windswept, lovely waters and beautiful rocks. There are some amazing apartments and houses along the clifftop from where you have amazing views of the coastline. Lovely

Nice beach and especially views around. Visiting Cape Town was done by scooter which provided me opportunity to travel anywhere and to Clifton Beaches of course. At one side the (cold) sea at the other side the boulevards and good restaurants. The culture of easy going

Nice beach not windy . Very nice place but you need to take the stairs to go down. There is no cafe or bar so if you have luck there will be some people selling drinks. The good thing is, the place is not windy.The bad thing is, the water is so cold.

Beatiful looking beaches. Although i have not been on one of the beaches i have passed by several times and wished i had more time to stop, the sand looks soft for walking clean and sea inviting and popular with families

Less busy then Camps Bay, still great beach. Clifton is between Camps Bay and Cape Town, Great for a beach day away from the city and if you like it a little less busy I would opt for Clifton instead of Camps Bay. Of course there are many more bays in the western cape .. but these are really close to town, so you don't have to go far, if you don't have a rental car.. just take a taxi.

Posh living on the cliff beaches. The road clings to the cliffs well above the sea. Posh apartments have been built, with the garages on the roof and lifts leading down to apartments and to the beaches. There are 4 beaches to enjoy, but access is rather difficult.
Ice cold water magificent views. I wondered why no-one else was swimming until I hit the water. Everyone stared as I exited!Table Mountain etc all in view.
My favorite Beach. Its a wonderfull beach destination with great ambiance and restaurants.Very near the City of Capetown ,only a 15 minutes drive.
Beautiful Beach. Crystal Clear Water, Mountain in the background, white sand. There is lot to like about this beautiful beach
Home sweet home. Great beach very cold water.... great for tourists but as a local it can be flooded with tourists there are more beachs that range from Clifton 1 -4
heavens on earth. lovely beach for luxury travelers, consists of 3 beaches one of them for gays ... lovely views and camera shots
Beautiful beaches in a beautiful area.. Well worth a visit. You can rent lounge chairs on the beach.there are several different beaches and all of them are lovely.

Beautiful Sunsets. I am really not a beach person. Being over 50 serves as a good excuse not to go normally, but these beaches are not to be missed at sunset. My son dragged his folks down the stairs to go watch the sun set on a recent visit to Cape Town. We have been going to Cape Town 2 to 3 times per year for the past 10 years or so. Never did we set foot on Clifton beaches till now. We have been missing out on the most peaceful, tranquil evening sunsets in the city. From now on it will be a must on every trip.We visited when there was some kind of tide coming in because apparently the beach was very small that evening, but it was not crowded, just sufficiently busy to be interesting and captivating. A pack of teenage girls played some game whilst couples trekked past dragging surfboards through the sand hugged by tired toddlers. Romantics huddled on rocks whilst other solitary figures enjoyed their own company. No one was in the water for obvious reasons. I had found the perfect beach! It was VERY relaxing and VERY beautiful.
great sunset beach. We took the bus out to watch the sunset from the rocks. You are between the mountains and cliffs and rocks and sunset. Really special.

Wonderful beaches. We've made a bus tour around Clifton and we decided to hop off on a beach, spending there few hours just sitting on a rocks, making pictures and enjoying the sun. The water was ice-cold, so we did not swim, but it was anyway worth to spend an afternoon there.
Beautiful setting. The beaches are beautiful, pristine and sitting below some jagged mountains. Where the other half (10%) live and disport themselves. The water is dreadfully cold!

Nice beaches but a bit commercialised. Really nice beaches, but they were a bit too busy for my taste, especially when there are beautiful beaches with not as many people a short drive away. Good that they are accessible by bus though, and nice and close to town.

Seriously some of the most BEAUTIFUL beaches!. I am not usually a beach lover--sure they are nice for an hour or two, but I typically prefer to be a bit more active, however Clifton really was quite a site to behold.Beautiful and pristine, these beaches were worth the long-ish trip for us from Rondebosch. We took a long walk around, taking in the sights, and dipped our toes in.Note that the water here was freezing, even during South Africa's summer.The best part about this beach was how few people were to be seen! In fact this is something of a trend that I've noticed in South Africa--the beaches here are really never crowded, there is only ever a few people wandering about so you can have plenty of room to yourself. Totally worth the trip!
Wow!. We saw these 4 bays from the bus and then had to get out and walk. Lovely beaches and homes. Beautiful beach but warned the water is like ice!

3 interconnecting beaches, 1 gay 1 straight 1 for dogs. not the best beach in Cape Town,but nice friendly people,You wont be swimming here as the water is icy cold, No nearby restaurants so take your lunch, lots of icecream and water available from beach sellers, Some steep steps from the road to the beach, a hard climb home

Beautiful Beaches .... BUT. the coldest water that I've ever had the great misfortune to have encountered anywhere in the world. It was just 14 secs paddling before frost bite set it. Allied to the heavy breeze that effectively sand blasts each exposed part of your body then what you have is a decptively unwelcoming environment that is on the face of it quite beautiful .... but do please beware !!!!
Nice beach. Is really nice, the water is could but is cold in all cape town. Is one of the best ones, not better than camps bay but nice!
Pristine beach. Beautiful, friendly and worth a visit although the walk up and down the steps are not for the faint hearted
Iconic beach. This beach has been popular with the locals and visitors for countless years. The water is very cold but the setting is beautiful.
International standards!. Cant believe the great beaches we have right on our doorstep, it's free, it's clean and there are so

Great Beach. You park your car and then walk down some pretty hectic steps to get to Clifton 4th Beach but its worth it. The sand is white and soft. We tried the water and got an instant brain freeze - yip its pretty cold - not sure how people swim there but they do. It is not over crowded.

Lovely beach close to Cape Town. Access to the 4 Clifton Beaches is only via steps. Park your car on the main road and walk down the steps past may houses and flats. Once your down at the beach you are rewarded with lovely white sand and beautiful views. However, the water is too cold for swimming.

Favourite Beach. Because you have to take steps down to it, it feels a lot quieter than the other Cape Town beaches. Sunbeds seemed reasonably priced and ice-cream/drink sellers are friendly and not too obtrusive. Didn't seem to be any of the hat/sunglass/tat sellers on here either.

4th beach as tucked away as possible in the city. We explored Clifton on a slightly foggy morning to beat the crowds and enjoy the white sand without chance of sunburn. Quiet in the autumn mornings, great for enjoying a cup of coffee or sinking toes into perfect sand. The stairs down to the shore wedge between beautiful houses - so much so that it can be difficult to tell whether the stairs lead to private property or public beach - look out for signage.
Try and go in winter. Some days in winter the sun comes out and it's the perfect time to go to Clifton. It's the only time you can the most amazing beach all to yourself.
Famous. We passed by for a fast stop. Nice, and also famous with the houses in the area, some of them 'criminal' !

Stunning Views. The Clifton beach area is surrounded by trendy restaurants and coffee shops which you can relax at and watch the sun set. There is also a supermarket in the area if you would just like to grab some snack and head straight to the beach.White sands and beautiful views, this beach has cold water of the atlantic so be warned if you would like to take a dip!This is one of the stops for the hop on/hop off bus.

A drive worth taking. My husband and I want on a great drive on our way to Cape Point, and we were stunned at the views and vistas. So absolutely beautiful and stunning. It was views we had never experienced before. The beauty, the scenery. This is an absolute must do

Without sounding biased, up there with the finest beaches in the world!. I have traveled around the world and been to lots of other beaches, I have noticed how most of the worlds "finest" beaches are inundated with services such as shops, bars, restaurants etc. In my opinion these things are enough to ruin a "top" beach as it no longer becomes a relaxing experience. Clifton has none of this, after walking down a few stairs you feel like you are on a different planet, no noise from bars or restaurants, luscious soft white sand, and cold refreshing water to swim in. There is the odd vendor walking around selling drinks or ice cream but not enough to disturb your tranquil experience in the sun. If you are looking for a relaxing beach experience rather than a party, Clifton is for you, luckily Camps Bay is only a 2 minute drive away with bars and restaurants to suit anyone's needs once you've had enough relaxing on the beach.

One of the most beautiful beaches in the world. The white sand, the azure blue clear sea, the views up Table Mountain, the crashing surf all make this beach a must-see. There are a number of steep footpaths with steps that take you down from the road to these beaches. There are clean toilets and water, but nothing else, but spectacular nature.

Gorgeous. Beautiful white sand beaches
Easy access, near a lot of shopping and a lot of activities
Spectacular views
beautiful beach, cold water, no services. The beach is small and beautiful, but the water is very cold and there are no services at all - no bar or restaurants.
Beach with awesome views. Good place to relax and enjoy some sun. Take plenty suntan lotion. Loungers and umbrellas available for hire. Peddlers sell water and ice creams

Cape Town's Unique Famed Tourist Attraction. Having travelled extensively around the world I am yet to find to find a set of public beaches which quite rival the exquisite setting of these unique pristine fine white sandy beaches. Set on the famed Atlantic Seaboard against a backdrop of some of the most expensive real estate properties in S. Africa these famous 4 beaches form alcoves with smooth weathered granite outcrop rocks acting as book end natural structures! IN fact there is a 5th beach which the locals refer to as `Moses' which is more secluded for those seeking a bit more privacy. The azure blue sea however is generally crisp and cold but always exhillirating and refreshing. During the summer vacation period the beaches are patrolled by resident life-guards; on occassion the seas can be rough with strong waves and currents and common sense should prevail. On most summer days the sea can be flat and enticing and one can also hire stand-up paddle boards enjoying a ride out to the anchored luxury yachts at Clifton 4th, The backdrop to Clifton is unparalelled from a beauty perspective with towering Lions Head Mountain set to the left and the Twelve Apostles to the right....you may even catch a glimse of Table Mountain nestled in the dip between the two mountianous settings. All in all a Must Do for tourists and up country visitors...you can hire lounger beds and umbrellas....enjoy this spectacular beach experience!

Beauty beayond words.. There are no words to describe the simple natural beauty offered at these beaches. For taking in the sun, family fun days out on the beach or romantic hide aways, these beaches offer all visitors something special to enjoy.

Take a stroll . Walked along Clifton 2 and 3 and took in the beautiful views with the mountains on the one side and the ocean on the other.Beaches are clean and umbrellas scatter the beach offering a great place to relax for the day.
Favourite beach. Loved this beach, secluded in a cove with lovely white sand and big waves. Chairs and parasols to hire if required.
Stunning!. Imposing cliffs and mountain range, azure blue ocean, white waves and white sand. Beaches don't get much better than this!!
Beautiful blue water. A very pretty setting with the blue ocean and lovely sand beaches. Lovely beach homes facing the water!

Nice but pretensious. As a Cape Townian, I love this beach, but only as the sun goes down! I generally avoid it during the day as it gets way to busy and its filled with the sorts or people I don't generally like to be around ( people from the area). But as a sundowner beach its amazing! I normally pack a little picnic and head down with some friends or my partner and just kick back and relax in true CT style
Find Parking early. Great place to spend a day or part there of, lot's of interesting people, take your own drinks, snacks.

Cleanest beach ever. Perfect for a hot summers day in Cape Towns beach capital. Cool off in the cold Atlantic Ocean by taking a swim. Famous for sport events & beach parties. Famous with international celebrities. Meet the friendly Cape Townians. Safe as long as you take care of you personal belonging. Food and beverages freely available from cafes & restaurants. Life guards and security on duty and visible .Showers on the beach. Clean rest rooms. Parking can be an issue on holiday or weekend. Perfect for sunsets. On route for the MyCiti bus tours.Child friendly.

Spacious, golden sands. The climb down to the beaches is worth the effort. There are 4 linked beaches, 1st, 2nd, 3rd and 4th, all with their own characteristics with rocky areas between them. The golden sand is lovely and beach loungers & umbrellas are available. Ice cream and water sellers wander through as there are no oter catering facilities. The cold Atlantic waters are welcome on a hot day! In high tide the breakers can be fierce but swimming on the water's edge is safe enough

Beautiful (bit overcowded) beaches. The beaches at Clifton are amazing, beautiful and clean. They get bit overcrowded during the weekends and late afternoons, as everyone is coming here to chill and relax. I would suggest going in in the morning, before the masses start coming (the water will still be cold, yet the sun is warm) or just go in the weekdays instead of weekends. The ocean is very clean, with nice big waves that keep you entertained for a while :)Also, there is a beautiful view from the beaches - you are just underneath the Table Mountain.

Beautiful bay. The Clifton bay is beautiful. A nice sandy beach, fantastic mountains, view up to the Table Mountain as well. But the water is very cold, only the bravest take a swim. Lots of restaurants etc. along the bay.
A great beach for bird watching. If you're into bird watching while enjoying the beautiful Cape Town summer, white beaches & a coll breeze then this is the place to go.

Super nice beach. We spent two relaxed hours late afternoon at beach No 2. Gorgeous sand, Rocks and water - which is actually pretty cold, definitely too cold for small kids. Also the heavy waves are not suitable for small kids. Nevertheless the colors and scenery totally make up for this...
Private and pleasant. Definitely my favourite beach in Cape Town. Beautiful, protected from all the wind and safe. You can rent off comfy sun beds and umbrellas to make it even harder to leave.

Beautiful but lacking facilities. Visited briefly in February. The beaches are pristine and beautiful. We walked three of them and all equally idyllic. Not to busy but it was noticeable that there were no real facilities or places to eat or get a snack (which we had hoped to do). As a consequence, you would need to sucumb to the beach traders which are a pain when you just want to relax and take on board some sun, sand and sea. As many travellers have also commented, the water temperature will inhibit swimming for most but certainly worth visiting regardless. Many have commented on getting there but parking the car on the high road and walking down the many steps through the houses was not a huge issue.
South African Views. Clifton is host to the most stunning homes with breath taking views. Definitely a must visit for tourists.

Very cold sea, & lots of steps. The sea was very cold, and there were a lot of steps to get down to the beach and back, but the beach was lovely once there. Great for watching the sunset over the sea! Our trip was cut short when out daughter needed to toilet.... And we found it was locked.

stunning. the shape of the four Clifton beaches creates a sense of personality often lacking in larger beaches. The sand is fine and white, the sea on the Atlantic coast understandably cold, but refreshing, and the setting, nestling as they do between the main city of Cape Town and the Camps Bay suburb, is magical, like an oasis. The cottages lining the beaches are perfect.

Gay friendly beach. Third Clifton beach has a free parking place for about 15 cars. So do park before 13:00.Cross the street and take a few steps down to the white sandy beach. Pay about 9 Euro you have 2 beds and an umbrella. And the crowd is 50 % gay so enjoy!
Relax. Secluded beaches even on a windy day. Quite a walk down the steps but very rewarding once there. The sea is chilly but invigoration.

Wind Free Beaches. Cape Town is notorious for the Cape Doctor (a strong south east wind) and when it blows the only beach of note that is wind free, is Clifton. While fourth beach is ideal for families and children (easier access) my favourite is Second beach - very few rowdy children. Being the Atlantic Ocean side of the Cape Peninsula the water is freezing at the best of times and if you can stand it there are good body surfing waves when the Atlantic swells roll in. The only negative is the steep climb up the steps to the road after enjoying the beach.The beach maintenance is good and teams keep it litter free on a daily basis.

cape town visit. clifton beach consist of three beautiful beaches. The first and second is a bit difficult to access. To get there, you need transport from the city center. Bus service is available. The water is great, clean and clear. For some people it may be to cold, then I advise them to go to nice beaches on the Indian Ocean, which is just around the corner
Clifton Beaches- best beach in cape town. Clifton Beaches- best beach in cape town ! if you want to chill go to Clifton1 if you looking for more a young vibe go to Clifton2
Beautiful Cold Water Beaches. The water is too cold to swim in but nice to look at. Watch a volley ball game and the young crowd walking around.

A ice beach but spilt with many hawkers. This is a beautiful beach but it is impossible to just enjoy it. There are too many hawkers who basically pester you all the time. The area around has some great restaurants worth visiting.

My favourite beach in the world.... The most beautiful white sandy beaches in the world. Clifton 4th beach is a paradise with I large beach where you can take your private spot, rent a chair and an umbrella and relax for hours on end in the gorgeous South African sun. The water is icy cold, but incredibly refreshing. Looking forward you see the gorgeous ocean and behind you you see the beautiful mountains... It is a spectacular day on the beach.

Sheltered from the wind. The first Clifton beach is private, but the second, third and fourth beaches are public, but you will need to walk down extensive stairs. If you do not want to take stairs, then head further down to Camps Bay. Clifton is better sheltered from the wind, but Camps Bay has the backdrop of the 12 Apostles.

Lovely beaches and stunning views and the sound of crashing waves.. So much fun catching the waves usually big strong ones, climbing huge boulders right on the beach or simply sitting lazily on the beach and taking it all in. One has to buy an umbrella to sit under and also be mindful of their property as it could very easily be stolen when one isn't looking. Better to go with company.
Nice clear water beach. Beautiful beach wtih white sand and blue clear water but a little bit cold.Beatiful landscapes behind Beautiful luxury villas behing as well ...
Beautiful beach . One of the most beautiful and relaxing beach in capetown as it is in a cove so it gets a little less windy than other beaches! Had a relaxing experience here..
outstanding - the best !. the beaches are wonderfuil with the setting of the mountains in the background and the blue blue sky with the crashing of the waves - its like walking into a movie.....
Beautiful. By far one of the most beautiful beaches in the world but beware,the water is COLD.....well worth a visit,might see some international superstars during the summer months.

Clifton 4. The Clifton beaches are fantastic spot to get out of the wind and enjoy some sun. We spent many an afternoon there this January. The vendors on the beach ensure you never go thirsty or hungry. Be warned the water is very FRESH ~12-13c.

Great beach. We were staying close to it so it was fairly easy to get to. Beach was beautiful and quite crowded. The water was too cold so wasn't that fun to get into. There could have been more options of restaurants or bars by the beach.

Amazing litle corners. Clifton beaches (they are 4) are accessible through narrow paths among the houses down the hill. Visit 2 of then ( clifton 3 and clifton 4) and they are lovely. At clifton 4 (the biggest) you have lifeguard..
That's what I call "Beach". Beautiful place, espically on hot days because the water is pretty cold. On a windy day there are few places next to the rocks (Clifton 3/4)

Blue Water, White Sand and Wind. This was a stunning beach. I can't say enough about how clear the water is, how beautiful the boulders are, and how soft the sand is. Clifton beaches are numbered 1-4. Each one has a "designated" style of person. While they aren't written rules, the locals know that each one attracts different beach goers. One is more popular with families, another for the beautiful people, etc. When we were there the weather was gorgeous but the wind was outrageous. We were getting sandblasted. We should have known that when we looked down over the beach and no one was on it, that it was a bad day to go to the beach. Also, there aren't a lot of food options around that area if you are looking to spend the whole day on the beach. If you're prepared of all of this, then you're fine! I also wouldn't suggest Clifton for anyone who has problems with stairs. The stairs are uneven and steep in places. And while this was fine for us, I know that my parents might have had a tough time. All in all, it was a beautiful place where you could rent umbrellas and chairs, but make sure before you climb down the stairs that you check out the beach from the street level to see if anyone is there. It will give you an idea of the weather below.

Beautiful beaches for beautiful people. What views of clean white sand, blue,blue sea & sky & pricey developments for those wishing to demonstrate their success & conspicuous consumption are to be had whilst strolling or running between Bantry Bay & Camps Bay which sooo many people do.Then to walk down the road between the houses with so much parking & garages one of which even had a turntable for easier access eventually to emerge on the rocks which revealed a view of dwellings only visible from this point, built between sea & road & sparsely peopled beaches.This outing did not cost us a single rand & was a feast for the eyes & so peaceful.
really really nice. except for the cold water, the beaches are perfect; on the day we were there, there was no crowd and we could really enjoy the calm and peace of the ocean
Perfect Beach, small Area, not so crowded!!!. Perfect Beach, nice sand, only a few people, shielded from the wind! no bars or cafe's just nature!! Exzellent experience!!

Probably one of the most Beautiful beaches in the world!. Clear water, snow white sand and beautiful people - majestic mountains - what more could you want? The beach is even serviced by local entrepeneurs that will set up your umbrella, pull up a deck lounger and every so often bring cool drinks and snacks along - want a massage on the beach - no problem...

Clifton @ Fourth Street. This is the first of four beaches - separated by gigantic boulders - and the most crowded. We rented chairs and umbrella for R150 and enjoyed the people watching with an occasional dip in the cold ocean. The next beach over also rents chairs and was more laid back, while the next two were sparsely attended and totally private. There are no restaurants along this stretch of the ocean other than the guys walking back and forth selling ice cream and drinks. Great way to spend the day, though next time I'd move further down the beach away from the crowd.
Scenic. Beautiful area, clean white sand, little rocky in places. Super for a stroll or a picnic with family and friends. Can get very hot as there is little shade. Fabulous views too.

Great Beach!. Parking was fairly simple and a simple hike to the beach. Stairs are a bit obscure, but most of them that were descending led to the beach (even though it looked like someones property). Beach was active. However, the use of the beach by irresponsible dog owners left an unpleasant mark.

Lazy sun days. Sheltered, pristine, popular. Perfect beaches to lounge on during Cape Town's hot summers. Stay for the sunset. Catch a bus rather than self drive, mind the steep pathways to access the beaches from the access road above.
views. Pretty much anywhere you go around cape town the views are stunning and the beaches are amazing. It well worth a road trip around to see them

4 different beach choices all in one!. There are 4 beach choices all in one at Clifton beach although the locals are vary in their description of each. Each are accessible from one to the next and separated by boulders of sorts. We went to what the locals call beach #4 which is for sure the family beach. The other beaches options are a topless one, a gay one and one for the types who think they have rockin' bodies or are rich and these descriptions are those of the locals not my words. ;) The positives of this beach is that it is clean and beautiful. The negative is that there are vendors from the beach itself who walk around all day long, literally every 60 seconds you will hear one of them say, "ice cold water or soda, chocolate or vanilla lollies." Which apparently a lolly is an ice cream on a stick of sorts. They were COMPLETELY ANNOYING but they work for the beach are just trying to earn a living. I just wished they seriously didn't walk all over so much and constantly be shouting. They have plenty of lifeguards on duty and there are public bathrooms and public parking if you drove your own car. You can also rent an umbrella or chair. The beach gets very crowded later in the day, at least on the family beach so get there early to get a good spot!
Stunning beaches. World class beaches, soft powdery sand, boulders and calm waves. Clean, wind free beaches and good vantage to see sunsets along the atlantic ocean...

Atleast a quiet beach to relax. A great place for a swim where it is not full as camps'bay beach.There is also surfing activities happening at the beach,You need to bring your own basket of food and drinks and chair and mat to relax and sun bask,but i have to warn you,the water is very cold a.It is a long visit and bring your cooler bag and camera.

Beautiful - but cold!. Really beautiful expanse of 4 beaches. Climb down through various stairways. Always many waves and sometimes very windy. Water also cold. Take the high road - Kloof Road - above the harbour for really beautiful vistas.

A day on the beach. These are truly stunning beaches with crystal clear freezing water and huge granite boulders. We spent the day on 1,2,3,and 4 and despite a hot shoot we nearly had the beach to ourselves. No pestering, safe to swim if you can brave the cold water. Really worth walking there from The Winchester Mansions.
Clifton Beaches. Indeed a beautiful and characteristic beach line own to Cape Town. But not necessarily the best beach area in and around Cape Town.
best beach in the world. unbelievable beach sand and you can get chairs and umbrellas on the beachthe sea is cold but there are lifeguards and you can swim

The locals' beaches. Clifton beaches is actually four interconnected beaches, only separated by variations along the shore. Perfect for relaxation, picnic or a get together with friends. Each beach has its own reputation. Clifton 4th is where you go to be seen. Another is supposedly LGBT friendly and so forth. The locals use Clifton beaches while the tourists go to Camps Bay Beach.

Gateway to Heaven. This is the most awesome beach to sit on and unwind my favourite time is after the beach has cleared and the sunset timeLots of people just enjoying the freedom to walk and enjoy the space Beach is always clean

Protected from Wind!!!!. Should you wish to visit the beach on a windy day, be sure to head down to Clifton! Not only will you not have any wind there, but you will enjoy one of the most stunning beaches this beautiful city has to offer! Even if it is not windy, please make sure that you pay Clifton a visit!!!

most beautiful beach. if you're looking for white sand, calm water and a beautiful setting, this is the beach for you. you can rent chairs and umbrellas on the beach, but be sure to take cash. There are resturants lining the beach front which makes having lunch or diner before or after perfect and the view is free.
My favorite beaches. White powdery sand and beautiful view. Parking can be difficult but once you are on the beach its lovely. Cold water on a hot day.

Best Beach in South Africa. The water might be cold, but this is truly one of the best beaches in South Africa. I visited most of the South African coastline and i can honestly say this is one of the most beautiful beaches I have visited.

White sand. We tried the 4th beach because of all reviews we read. The beach is really nice but not exceptional. The day we visited ot qas not clean. Crowed qith many people but good enought. Water was really cold but crystal clear.

Beautiful!. Lovely peaceful beach to relax on. Cold icy water, white sands and breathtaking views. Similar to Camps Bay, can get very crowded, but over all a lot more peaceful and less of the hustle and bustle

Gets Really Packed but worth it. Clifton is a unique beach - very popular with locals and spread into 4 beaches.
Does get a bit busy but the best place to find beautiful people and play beach games.

Sunset on the beach. If you want to be away from the bustle of Camps Bay then Clifton is the place. Take a picnic basket, good book and sunscreen. There are also amazing sunsets from Clifton. Remember that there are four Cliftons names Clifton 1 to Clifton 4. Drinking is forbidden on most beaches in Cape Town, please read the info boards when approaching the beach.

Sexiest beaches in Cape Town. Well worth the stop and the little trek down the steps to the bottom. Fantastic views and photo opportunities, the most beautiful water and powdery fine sand and also not inundated with crowds/tourists like Camps Bay. We loved it!
Best beach in the world. The Clifton Beaches are my favorite in the world!Pristine white sand and beautiful turquoise water.. and they're one of the most sheltered spots in Cape Town
Nice but beaches 2 and 4 are overcrowded. Nice but beaches 2 and 4 are overcrowded. I'd recommend sticking to beaches 1 and 3. The land itself is still beautiful.
Perfect Beach-ing. Clifton beaches are undeniably beautiful, it is well-kept regardless of the extremely cold waters when compared to Durban beaches.
Fun and clean beaches. Great place to unwind with kids. Wonderful soft sand and crystal clear water. Unfortunately, the water is icy cold.

Postcard beaches. Crystal clear waters, white sand. This is paradise. The water is icey, but lots of people brave it anyway. 4th beach (closest to Camps Bay) is the trendiest and always buzzing. try 1st beach for a bit of quiet. The hike up and down to the beach can be a bit rough in the heat but it's very manageable. Easily reachable with the bus or a cab.
Heavenly. Beautiful beaches with freezing dangerous seas. Several to choose from via approaches down from the road at the top
Amongst the best beach in the world. White sand, clear water, just beautiful. Note that this is on the Atlantic side so the water is very cold - almost impossible to swim.

Chic beaches of Cape Town. This beach (actually split into 4…1&2 are the trendy beaches, 4 is for the families) is gorgeous. The sand is pure white, and the waves a re huge and gorgeous. It reminds me of beaches at home in France on the South Ouest coast (Cap Ferret). I love big waves, and swimming and diving around in those ones was so much fun. Lack of Gulf Stream and presence of Antarctic currents mean the water is freezing (!5-16º C i guess) but it's refreshing and tonic (I like cold water). If you're feeling brave, you can go for a swim (I'd recommend Clifton 4 because it's supervised and the waves are smaller) or just a walk along the beach with thigh-high water for a little detox (cold water is so much healthier ;) ) .I think just seeing them is worth it, and who knows, you might just catch a celebrity.
White Sand. Vast expanse of water and beautiful white sand-the beach was very beautiful. The water was icy cold. The sun set view was awesoem.
Miss Green. By far Cape towns most beautiful beach.Awesome Views right around the beach, water is blue and elegant, just has a different vibe and feel to it than the other beaches.

Amazing Clifton 4th Beach. We go to Clifton 4th beach most days at around 3:00pm. Every time unlike other beaches the sand feels like baby powder, the tide is sometimes rough usually at high tide. We usually stay there and watch the sunset, and you can even walk up and down from 1st beach to 4th beach, as usually the sea is very cold but incase you have a heart attack the life guards are always there, the only reason why I'm giving this beach a 4 star is because of the amount of seaweed in the sea when your swimming, you often stand on hard shells and sea weed stems that could cut you if you stand on it.

Pretty beach. We went to Clifton beach at high tide. There was still plenty of beachfront to lay our towel down. I'm not sure if it is a Cape Town thing or not, but the men selling Coke, water, and lollies continuously walked up and down. I began to get irritated that they were in my quiet zone. We stayed in beach 1 the furthest from the entrance. It was the nicest of the 4 areas. The boulders define each area. The sand was pretty and the water cold. It was very enjoyable!

Go here at night!. Clifton's beaches are always packed during the day, but when you come here at night, there are usually only a few other people. Bring along some candles and snacks, and chill out with some friends. Just don't make too much noise, because the house owners sometimes call security to remove everyone from the beach when it gets too noisy.

SPECTACULAR. We trundled off to the beach with the family for sundowners. I have forgotten how spectacular Clifton is in the summer.Yyou feel as though you are on a movie set its so beautiful. It was clean and lovely.
Nice. Nice beaches. Clifton 4th is my favourite.2nd is nice but, it can be packed during the weekend. Nice to chill out and see beautiful people !
Beautifull. Clifton is one of the most beautiful urban coastlines of South Africa. Stunning views and beautiful beaches.

Stunning beaches but cooooold. This is a must see for people going to Cape Town for the first time! However, water is very very cold so just to enjoy the view and the place ...worth the visit anyways!!!

busy, lots of europeans. it is a beautiful beach in the cape town area. Probably the most western europeans in the area but it is a beauty with all the restaurants and bars. If you are on for a party this could be an excellent choice. For the person looking for nice view and top restaurant you might have to rethink. It is good food but not michelin star!

Miami In Africa. I love the 3rd beach most as it offers you sexy models in bikinis and machos with 6 packs. Clifton beachs give you a beautiful view of the beach, and accross you have an arrray of restaurants to choose from. Italian, Chinese... what do you want? and yh you get to see the bay hotel as well
South African roadtrip . A beautiful stretch of coastline that is worth a visit and a few hours take a picnic and just relax the hours away.

Beautiful Setting & Beaches. Beautiful little suburb of Cape Town. Beautiful beach, but I'm not sure the water is warm enough to go in. They had some lawn bowling areas which were also nice. Nice Serene place to visit for a few hours.
Thursday evenings on Clifton 2nd Beach. World class beach, beautiful setting. Definitely worth a visit. Water too cold to swim though. Thursday evenings there are volleyball nets set up, join in.

Beautiful Sunset. I lived in Cape Town for almost 9 months when my apartment was being built. Once or twice as week my wife and I used to go to Clifton. We would sit on the rocks and watch the sun going down like a great golden ball till it disappeared into the sea. It was the ideal scenario to sit and do our evening prayers in this this tranquil setting. We very rarely went over on weekends as the beach get far too busy with visitors and parking is a problem. Very nice spot for swim.
Nice blue water!. The beach area is not a big stretch, certain areas are rocky, entry is not so easy, not easy to amenities.

Beautiful beach to enjoy. Although cold (Atlantic side) this is a stunning and breathtakingly beautiful beach and the views of the mountains from here is spectacular. Go in the morning or evening to avoid heavy sun..

Nice sandy beach. I like sandy beaches. I liked this beach because it was spacious. But look out which part you go to. It's up to you, which part...part for the family...part for couples...and one is gay friendly. All of it very nice. The water is too cold for my taste. I am spoiled by the Mediterranean and the likes.
White Sand. Beautiful white sand beaches with aqua blue waters. Need say no more. (shark spotters an added bonus)
Superb place to hang out. The beaches of Clifton and camps bat are a great place to relax and kick back. There are many upmarket resturants and is nice area to unwind.

Surreal. I live in southern california, but these beaches offer such a secluded slice of paradise here that you rarely find in Socal. I rented an AirBNB and stayed right on the water for what a regular hotel would run you in the states. I was there in shoulder season, but it might as well have been summer. It was heaven everyday I woke up hearing the waves crash and got to witness incredible sunsets right from my room. Can't say enough good things about these beaches.
nice view place. Its beautiful beach - not for swimming, but for viewing the scenery and relaxing.Water is so cold and wind so hight - but i wanna stay and see again.
Powder white sands and turquoise waters. Clifton Beach is one of the finest beaches in the Cape, and probably one of the finest beaches in the world. Unfortunately, the water is VERY cold.
Nice!. Clifton beach 3 is for the gays! On a summers day this beach will be packed with hot men! Its a nice area, a nice beach and even nicer men arround you!

Wow.. The most stunning beach in the world... Totally and utterly bliss when you go to Clifton.. Like being in Europe all year round. Safe as there is always security and life guards on watch.. Family beach for sure : )

Beautiful beaches and beautiful people. I loved these beaches, the people watching is great and the beaches are so beautiful. I was almost intimidated by the reputation of all the beautiful people that gather at Clifton Beaches but no worries, you will fit right in with the other tourists.

White sand on the west coast. I liked this beach for a few reasons, you can hire umbrellas and chairs. It has a restroom. Its perfect on a sizzling hot day because the sand is cold and so is the sea. Do remember your sunscreen lotaion

Teenagers' farewell on the beach. End of academic year, group of grade 11s had lots of fun on Clifton's 4th beach. Arrived late afternoon and stayed until sunset. Picnic, bat & ball, swimming, tanning...

Stunning Beaches and Developments to Match. We drove all the Clifton Beaches during our trip to Cape Town. The sand was white, and while there were plenty of people on the beaches, few swimmers were in the water. The surrounding area has numerous grand residences and high rise apartments, typical of other beachfront living across the globe. There are plenty of restaurants and bars along the strip to add to the day's entertainment. A pleasant way to spend some time on a lazy afternoon.Thanks for your vote if you found this review helpful.

White sands and noone around. This was like my own beach almost - no one around white sands and they were so clean. A brief dip in a very cold sea but an amazing feeling please do find your bit of heaven
THE Beach. This is where the Celebs go. The nicest homes right along the beach cliffs and the nicest beach in Cape Town.

Stunning Beaches. Cape Town's Clifton beaches are on par with Thailand and other Asian beaches.Beautiful clean sparkling ocean and white sands. One can enjoy all year round.Nothing beats walking one of these beaches whether on a warm sunny or a cold wet winter's day. The beaches gets its most visitors during the December/January Cape holidays so one has to go really early to get a great spot. A visitors dream!

Simply beautiful. Clifton is made up of four beaches separated by massive boulders. 4th beach is mainly a family beach, 2nd and 1st beach is for those with the hot bodies who are not shy to show them off.
Stunningly beautiful and very busy!. Eating lunch there was a real treat because we could enjoy the turquoise water yet be away from the crowded beach.

Hawai in South Africa. White sandy beaches... just absolute breath taking. Take your own beach umbrella and relax on the beach. View is extraordinary...have lovely boulders and an awesome tidal pool. Food available close by in the many restaurants a short walk across the road from the beach.

Awesome sunset. We took some wine and cheese to this beach not far from the city and had a magical afternoon. The beach wasn't crowded at all and we even hit the water for a few seconds - it's very cold.

The Best Beach In Town!. I love Clifton Beaches. If you are spending any time in Cape Town this is a great beach to hang out and get some sun. You can also grab some drinks and food at one of the nicest nearby restaurants or bar.
Gorgeous. The Clifton Beaches are stunningly beautiful. Plus, some of the most expensive property in South Africa looms over them. Pearl white beaches with some handsome/beautiful people about.
Stunning. Beautiful area with the most amazing beaches and surroundings. World class and a must to visit and enjoy.

Beautiful beaches surrounded by concrete. Clifton beaches are truly beautiful but unfortunately they are surrounded by huge horrible buildings...Really wish the city of Cape Town would protect the coast better. Such a shame...

Fantastic beaches. These beaches are beautiful and really worth visiting. The surrounding houses are interesting for a sneak peak given their prices, but the beaches are what you come for. The surf can be a bit cold and rough, but you can get out for a swim, surf, or anything else. A great place to spend the afternoon.

Gorgeous beaches, time for a tan. We were surprised at how beautiful these beaches were. Easy to find cozy, quiet inlets to yourself too! If the weather is right, you can get a tan, then walk up to the road for drinks and food. You can have it ALL in Cape Town!

The sea speaks for itself. I could not do justice to describe this spectacular beach..it's all about lazy days with a good suntan lotion, a chardonnay or 2, a striking Sun hat to feel like royalty...the beach certainly sets the tone

Sheer Beauty. We always visit Cliffies during our stay in Cape Town. Brings back wonderful memories of my youth where, we spent all day basking away in the sun out of the reaches of the strong south easterlies.
Each beach has its own specific character. Despite the sea being cold, the utter beauty makes up for this small disadvantage.

One of the best in Cape Town. Clifton beaches - there are 4 of them - are a great space to enjoy the beach in Cape Town, although the water is always ice cold. One of the beaches is mostly frequented by gay people.

Lazy Sunny Days. A beautiful place to rest in the sun with a quick way to cool off very close. It is surrounded by nature and is an amazing landscape. The sea is breathtaking and is worth every step you take to get there!
Gorgeous!. Unbelievable scenery. Easy to get to on the hop-on-hop-off bus. Restaurants. See how the top-end folks live in Cape Town.

Great place to relax on the beach. Beautiful views and great fauna and flora, was there a while ago, and almost everyone is helpful and stress-free.
the beaches are well-kept and clean.

Mini Miami. Privacy but yet accessible to all.
Beach is great and safe.
Always hectic and full if in Summer visits

Soak up the sun at Clifton. Be prepared, pack enough for a long day at Clifton Beach.Be it 1st, 2nd or 4th beach... you'll find that the crowds differ at the various "coves" at Clifton Beach. So wander round and look for the spot that's most pleasing to you.Parents with kids... be warned... this is an open minded beach and if you're homophobic or afraid of spotting the odd pair of nude boobies... rather go to Camps Bay with your young ones.Remember to pack sunblock! Don't let a few hours in the sun spoil the rest of your holiday due to sunburn. Also take along a couple of Rands to purchase ice cold drinks or ice cream from the vendors who dwell the beaches with their goods. Be sure to arrive early to find a parking spot and best place on the beach.
Trendy neat Clifton Beaches. Awesome beach very alive and trendy, nevertheless the water is cold throughout the year.A must when in Capetown
Great beach. Very good beach, but not easy assessable due to the steep steps. But the walk is worth it. If your a sunbather, this is the place to be.

Very nice and reaxing experience. Great bit of coastal landscape and really relaxing along this part of the coast.It is worth taking a walk across the beach areas and also up to Llandudno and Camps Bay.

Wow . What a beach. Cycled here along the coast, certainly worth the effort. The beach has the wow effect, you cannot see the beach from road level so take a walk down one of the many paths. You will not be disappointed.

Ice cold water, white sand, beautiful people, great ambiance. Don't be fooled by the azure blue water which looks just soooo tempting! Even during the height of summer, even when your hotel pool is pleasantly warm, the ocean on this side of Cape Point will be ice- cold. But don't miss it. Your swim might last 30 seconds, but your visit much much longer!
Like Europe, right on your doorstep. Very cold water, exquisitely clean water and white sand beaches. The place to be in Cape Town. You can visit ant time of the year.

Blue blue seas. While the water maybe cold these are some of the best beaches in the world. We were there in Mid September on a bright sunny day and it was superb. A must fior anyone visiting Cape Town
Sightseeing. Excellent place to spend a full day sightseeing and buying presents ect. Also a very good choice of restaurants and bars.

The group of beaches called cliftons 1-4 . Clifton 3rd is the gay beach as well as the nudist beach down at Sandy bay. The Clifton's and their beaches are ok , however you have a hike down stairs and then back up later to go home,there is little intone way of facilities down there so be sure to take everything you need. There is a man selling ice creams and chilled drinks but no bathroom. The water isn't warm as it's the Atlantic but it's bearable to cool off in and there is 1 fresh water shower to get rid of the salt. Swimmers beware there are submerged large boulders just beneath the surface which if a wave catches you unaware can seriously hurt you.Traveller tip all along that set of beaches including camps bay have rip currents which can be very strong. If you get caught in one do not panic,flow with it, then at your closest point to the beach swim in as they pull you out then die off. If you fight against it, use up all your energy fighting to get back to shore you will exhaust your self and end u potentially in more trouble. Take Heed !!

Great beaches to visit from Cape Town centre. We used the hop on hop off bus to come here and stroll around for the afternoon. Plenty of bars, cafes, restaurants to stop at before you pick up your return bus

Wonderful...... ......and just beautiful beaches. Allow plenty of time as these beaches are worth it. We only had a whistle stop as we were on an organised tour so would have liked longer - but we opted for more time at the 12 Apostles instead - hobsons choice really. This is worth doing for sure.

Worth going to. Very very beautiful beaches, there are four of them I think. all of them are beautiful but the water is very very cold. I was expecting cafes and restaurants but I did not see any I could be wrong

Cool for the Summer. Clifton 4th is by far the busiest but most family friendly of the four beaches. Go early or risk facing no parking. Cristal clear azure waters, soft white sand, lifegaurds, clean toilets, beautiful people and the friendly banter of the refreshment vendors make this beach, THE beach for the summer.

Life's A Beach. We drove over here from Tabletop Mountain for lunch. Beautiful and scenic. After lunch we walked the beach and watched the beachgoers enjoy themselves as we did too. It was their winter and the water was cold, but not so bad as there were many people in the surf. Its was relaxing and enjoyable, we then went on to Chapman's Peak drive for more sightseeing.

Great place to chill on a sunny day. We headed down here on a gorgeous sunny day and nothing much beats it!The view is great and you can watch the surfers and just enjoy in being in a stunning part of the world!

Beautiful beaches. Beautiful sandy beaches, lots of sun in the summer with little chance of rain. Best experienced during the December January summer holiday period. Parking can be a problem so make sure you get there early. Water is colder here than on the North coast, so if you don't mind, enjoy!
Beautiful scenery with ice cold water. The 4 beaches are beautiful and is a great place to be. Just be aware that year round the water is ice cold and therefor not ideal for swimming.

CHARMING CLIFTON BEACH.. A beautiful bay a short distance out of Cape Town, with mountain backdrops to the beach. The coastal drive to the Cape is well worth while, as so much to see at every turn of the road. Loved it!
Summertime Swim. Always great in the summer! despite the icy cold waters, the views are great and there is a nice friendly family vibe!

One of the best in the world. Clifton actually comprises 4 beaches all accessible once on the beach. In summer it gets crowded and parking is a mission. I suggest hopping on the bus from sea point if that is where you staying.personally I prefer 4th beach as it has the least stairs. All 4 beaches have stairs and it gets hot very very hot. The beach is protected from wind so is the warmest in Cape Town. Beautiful clean powdery sand and a view which is in itself great. That does not include the view on the sand however with gorgeous people all over the show. The ocean is cold but it gets so hot in summer that a swim is definitely on. There are some facilities available such as loungers drinks etc. I would though suggest taking lots of sunscreen and water though.Fabulous beach where you can tan to your hears content
Just another lovely spot in Paradise!. Lovely beach & nice place to stop. We enjoyed everything about our visit to Cape Town. It's such a diverse city!
White sands and clear icy blue water. The water is refreshingly cold (understatement) and these are popular beaches for all ages..each of the 4 beaches has it's own character and crowd.

Too Beautiful and amazing. Clifton Beaches are extremely Beautiful.Lovely white sand to walk on and very clean.Many travelers and tourists are to be found.Lots of birds are seen flying around and its just great to be there.I would strongly recommend visitors to go to Clifton Beaches.
Beautiful beach. One of the best beaches near Cape Town. Also very beautiful because of the mountain back drop. There are also some nice restaurants along the coastal road.

My Beautiful Cape Town. Very nice beach. Water is very cold as it is on the Atlantic Ocean side. I would not go there on the 1st and 2nd January as the indigenous people come by the bus loads to picnic and the restaurants are closed. Very nice for sunbathing!
Lovely Beaches. Beautiful, clean, non-touristy beaches! Just watch out - the water is really cold but doesn't ruin a lovely day out at the beach.

Clifton 4th Beach Cape Town. We went to Clifton 4th beach. The only way I can give directions is to say that there is a small car park on the other side of the main road, opposite the beach. You then have to cross the busy road and walk down another samll road that leads to a few houses and the beach. Very nice beach - highly recommend.

Most beautiful beaches in Cape Town. These are the most beautiful beaches in Cape Town! But beware the icy Atlantic ocean, you won't be swimming for very long! Also note that these beaches are quite sheltered from the South Easterly wind, so Camps Bay might have gale force winds while Clifton is only experiencing a gentle breeze.Toilets and outside showers are available along with the typical Capetonian hawkers selling "cooldrinks and lollies". It gets very crowded in December and traffic becomes a nightmare, so during the busy season rather take a cab or MyCiTi bus to get there because parking is a problem.

Cold splendour!. WOW - this would probably be the best way to describe the 4 beautiful beaches accessible to each other via the freezing Atlantic or walking across the boulders. The privacy and beauty of the beaches will astound you. The water, as mentioned, is freezing but worthwhile an attempt!

From students & Surfers to the Gliterati. There are four (well, maybe five beaches -- Moses Beach is seasonal) associated with the name Clifton Beaches. They have granite boulders and white sand. Moses Beach has papyrus plants and is under water much of the time. The fourth beach is valued by the glamorous and well-to-do with families. Many yachts anchor in this area. The other three beaches in the area are a draw to gays, students and surfers. There are many small bungalows which draw large groups on weekends for continuous parties. The fourth beach is much more serene and quiet. Tourists will enjoy mixing with the local population.
Beautiful!. Beautiful white sand. Clean and neat. Perfect beach to just relax and enjoy life. Set aside an entire day just sitting, sunbathing and taking in the beauty.

World class sunset and picnic. As a local, I would recommend the beaches as follow:Fourth beach - this is the largest beach, is the furthest south (near Camps Bay side) and is near the car park. This beach is frequented by families and children and there are life guards on duty. Toilets.Third beach – it is a smaller beach, you will find less people here. Accessed by stairs.Second beach – it is filled with interesting people, often playing sports, making music etc.Accessed by stairs.First beach - is secluded and private. Accessed by stairs. ToiletsMy favourite is second beach, especially for a picnic. Arrive well before sunset, settle on the sand or rocks, unpack your feast and enjoy the vibe. World class scenery and entertainment for free.

Among the world's best. Fantastic atmosphere, nestled among mountains, white sand so fine it squeaks beneath your feet, no stores on the beach or beachfront, just some vendors of drinks and ice-creams. Somewhat marred by beach-bat players and the like on the main beach, which is very body-beautiful; go to one of the smaller ones if you prefer quiet. Freezing water; dry heat...it's better than any spa. Once I stayed in a house on this beach and say rescued wolves running out on the rocks. Whales go by, dolphins.

Beautiful small beaches!. I love these beaches because it is so beautiful with the amazing houses and mountain behind you. From the parking it is a bit of a walk which is great because you don't have any cars close to the beach.

Ugh, no thanks. Not for everyone. The water is freezing cold. Its best at sunset for a long walk along the shore.
But on a hot summer's day it is best avoided. The traffic is terrible, the beach is too full.

Magical sunsets. Spread your blankie perfectly timed for sunset on Fourth Beach kic bac and drift into a truly magnificent scene straight out of a travel magazine while watching Chinese lanterns lift off into forever
Over developed. Beautiful set of beaches absolutely ruined by development of apartments and hotels along the ocean front limiting parking and access.

Camps Bay is much nicer and accessible.. Difficult to access...narrow road...parking shortage and high risks with thieves breaking in your car! Clifton is the CT mecca for super rich but not easily accessible....Unless you have a rich friend living there!

Nice beach. If you haven't yet thought about it, the most important fact is that the water is cold. This is on the atlantic ocean side. Go east. If you want to swim (comforable), Indian ocean is the place. But Clifton is nice. Not crowded.
best in the land. cold water, hot sun. go early to get a parking. make sure you grab a granadilla lolly and play some bat and ball

beautiful natural beaches. Absolutely beautiful set of beaches, natural clean with gorgeous views. In my personal opinion it is the best beach in Capetown. Best to visit out of season to enjoy the beauty of it in private, as it tends to be packed during summertime..

The best place to be at sunset. Nothing like lying on Cliftons beaches to watch the orange sun ball disappear into the ocean .... The people on the beach are usually really laid back.... One of my favorite summer treats... Some snacks and drinks, soft drinks of course....hmm. And soak up the glorious world we live in .....

Good beach but.... Clifton is a good beach and is clean and beautiful but can often feel like a fashion parade. Everybody seems to be walking around wanting to be noticed. We are fortunate in the Western Cape that there are many beaches that are great for relaxing and is safe for a family day out without the attitude. Would not drive to far to get to this beach.

Best beaches to visit in the off season. Although it's illegal to drink in public in South Africa, no one will look twice if you open a bottle of wine for a sundowner on any of the Clifton beaches. Super cheap to rent an umbrella and loungers. Water and ice cream vendors on the beach are always nearby. It's one of my favourite places. But don't go there in high season. Seriously, just don't.
Perfect for beach lovers. Soft sands and cool blue water make The Clifton beaches ideal for a sunny, lounge-worthy day. Be advised that the path to the beaches involve a great number of stairs.

Don't miss this beauty!. The beaches are clean, the people are trendy and the water is clear blue. Yachts sail past effortlessly and the shores are fully lined with a vast array of restaurants, coffee shops and interesting nooks and crannies.
A day in the sun. White sands, beautiful blue flag beaches and summer babes in stunning bikinis. Take you sun block and sunglasses
Jet-setting. If you're a jet-setter with heaps of cash (or dreams of heaps of cash), Clifton beaches is the place to be seen. Not my cup of tea, but well worth the scenic visit

Wow!. Clifton, and its neighbor Camps Bay, share in the most gorgeous beaches, with beautiful fine sand, amazing rock formations and stunning homes overlooking the action. The water is hypnotic, and sunsets are spectacular. The lucky few who live here, within easy striking distance of downtown Cape Town, have this pinnacle of nature at their feet. Go here and let the wind sweep through your hair.

Beautiful clear waters. Beautiful clear blue water, perfectly toned bodies and if you want to see and be seen by the rich, famous, beautiful and hottest people in Cape Town then for sure this is the place to be. lovely majestic mountains as the backdrop, loads of restaurants and spectacular houses around
scenic clear water. Nice to chill out. Quiet , scenic and relaxing beach. Not much of commercialized but good to visit if you want peace

best beaches in Cape Town. I would say from a sun sea and surfing point of view that Clifton, camps bay and sea point have the best beaches in the world. I say this because they are whithin 10 minutes of the city and table mountain, have squeeky clean white sand and are blue flag rated.There is always a wave for the experienced surfer/ body boarder who is willing to brave the cold with a wet suit. It gets seriously juicy if you know where to go according to wind swell and tide. It also has stunning women and men sunbathing lazily before retiring back to a restaurant and having lunch or sun downers. Clifton is known as the most beautiful beach in the world! contact me i fyou want to know insider info or tour , sail , surf , fish dive or sight see. Will Gubb Full Impact marketing

Sea Sand and Sun. 4 Beautiful white sandy beach coves for sun tanning but be warned the water is ice cold. Very busy with locals and visitors to our shores. Best to take the MyCiti bus as parking almost impossibe.

Lifestyles of the rich and famous. If you want to feel like a film star visit these magnificent beaches in Clifton and relax on white powdery sand whilst enjoying one of the best scenic spots in the world. Locals flock to Clifton beach every day but you're also guaranteed to hob nob with socialites. Clifton is the Cannes of Cape Town. Take a picnic, hire a beach umbrella and make sure you bring tons of sunblock - its hot and wind free any time. The water is icy cold though, almost impossible to swim - bear that in mind if you fancy a good long swim. It's not going to happen at Clifton.
Awesome - just the way a beach should be. Lovely beaches, great sand, and nice clean clear water - what more do you need - oh yes, and there was sun. - just perfect

Best beach in the world. Clifton Beach in Cape Town has to be the best beach in the world. Protected, beautiful white sand and such refreshing water on a hot day. Clifton 4th is by far the most popular and on a weekend in summer, you have to get down early to find decent parking. Why not have a picnic on the beach on a hot summer night. It is absolutely awesome

Great Beaches , Tough to park. Really nice beaches all up the streets. Restaurants & shops all along the way. The water is extremely cold, but the sand is warm. It gets crowded & tough to park as the day goes on.
Great Tanning Area. Great beach to tan on a warm sunny day, great view of the sea, great for sun downers and great view on sunset

Best beaches. Parking in the beach area is an absolute nightmare, but while you drive around looking for a parking spot, you can enjoy the most beautiful scenic beaches. Lots of restaurants on the beachfront. Cape Town's best kept "secret"?
Only place to be on a Sunday afternoon. my kind of paradise the only place to be on a sunday afternoon, all the beautiful people the only problem is finding parking
Nothing quite like this!. The four Clifton beaches - nothing quite like them anywhere else in the world. Beautiful blue water and majestic mountains as the backdrop.
Penguins!!!. Yes, there are penguins in South African. Great beaches in this area. Parking can be a bit dicey, but if you go later in the afternoon, it's not too bad.

Hello!!!. Come on!!! Clifton is top of the heaps. From Clifton first to Clifton 4th... all great beaches. Whether you're fat or thin, tanned or bleached, single or familied - it's for everyone. The water is colder than cold but if you want to be seen by the rich, famous, beautiful and hottest people in Cape Town then this is the place to be seen.Enjoy!
good exercise going down. We went to the beach going down the stairs. I would not mind doing it everyday for exercise. Nice clean beaches if you want a bit of privacy it is a must go.
best beaches in Cape Town. Soft, white sand, protected beaches, suntanning. the best beach experience in Cape Town. Even the icy cold water was refreshing!

Incredible. Such a paradise!!! Be ready to take pretty photos and enjoy the view. Also for the strong wind!
I was there in march 2014

Seriously overrated!. The beach is quite nice, but the land side is amazing crowded with housing. No place to park. Few places to eat. If you want a chance to hobnob with the self proclaimed rich and beautiful of South Africa, or at least stare at their supper expensive apartments (no houses to speak of) and watch them drive off in their super expensive cars, by all means go.
