Lovely beach. White sand, crustal clear water, coo people and nice small bar.The place is relaxing and fancy. If you are a viking you jump in the cool fresh water. And don´t miss the bar above the parking place. Cool champagne and soft music

Great!. the clifton beaches are close to city bowl, maybe 15 min by car from the centre.the beaches are clean with a spectacular houses around, and the beach itself are very nice but the water is very cold, it must be that very,very hot days to enjoy the sea.very nice atmosphere even if your not with swimsuit. great to watch sunset, grab an ice cram, a walk through the 3 beaches.I recommend Clifton the second

Pity the sea is so COLD!. Magical beach. We felt like we were on a tropical island with the white and the turquoise sea. Beach was clean. You could hire pool loungers to lie on. Parking was minimal but worth the walk to this amazing beach.

Great as usual. The beach is beautiful with the best sand to relax and play games on, but the water is freezing. So go on a sunny day and dare yourself to go in. Once you are in, you will be fine and enjoy it all!

Spectacular and close to but far enough away from Cape Town!. Highly recommended.The beach area in Clifton is spectacular. It's scenic and located at the foot of the downtown area offering a picturesque and quaint seaside dining and shopping experience.What's there not to like about this? Perhaps, the dense traffic and crowds all year long. But then again, that's evidence Clifton is worth a visit.

Clifton Beaches, Cape Town. These are a series of beaches in the most beautiful of settings. White sands and blue oceans. But there are some aspects to be wary of. The water can be extremely cold, so be prepared. Parking is almost impossible on a hot day, especially in Season, so be warned. Do not leave items on the beach unattended as they are likely to be stolen. I learnt the hard way! As you progress beyond Clifton there are many other beaches, such as Camp's Bay which are also really lovely, but if you are seeking warmer ocean water head out to Fishoek or Muizenburg.

The most beautiful beaches in Cape Town!. Without doubt these are the most beautiful beaches in Cape Town. Don't be put off by the steep steps its worth the trip. Clifton 4th is the most popular but if you want something less crowded try 1st or 2nd beach.

one of Cape Town's beach. The beach is of the left hand side of the city. The beach itself is popular with local people. It is with white sand, with some rocks, a beautiful colored but cold water.
The residential part of the hill dominating the beach has nice houses enjoying a great view.

Clifton is a landmark. Clifton beaches are unique and private.
There is always a nice crowd there and people just chilling.
The atmosphere is private and beautiful.
Take a walk and admire the views 360 degrees.

Charming little white sand beach (#4). Visited a small stretch of beach in early autumn weather. The water was crystal clean (yet freezing cold) with amazing sand and peculiar rock formations. Picturesque place, recommended even at cold weather.

nice place to hang out. if you want a day trip i would recommend you visit clifton beaches and Llandudno beach and if you have the whole nice day even drive the Chapmans road to Kalk bay city. It is a nice day trip.

Superb Beaches. Clifton has 4x beaches with various types frequenting them. We headed for Beach 4 which is family friendly and the biggest with best services. Beware it's a bit of a hike down the hillside paths to the beaches.
Beautiful. Such a beautiful beach to take in the sun. With the juxtaposed mountains to ocean, it doesn't get any better
Fun and freezing. Definitely worth seeing for the beauty. Coldest water I have ever been in---don't even think about swimming--fun to walk on beach.

"Simply Stunning". Clifton Beach is a beautiful beach - great for photos (Sunsets are 1st prize). Lovely and clean for a walk or to relax (I am a Durban girl - water to cold for me). Loads of people around great atmosphere. Good choice of cafe's to enjoy a snack.

Gorgeous beach. One of the nicest beaches that we have seen. Great spot for pictures as you have a view of the 12 apostles behind the beach. There are also many nice cafe to stop and have lunch. Good way to spend an afternoon. Just beware of the hot sun.

Stunning beach. A recommended must do on a hot day, the beach is pristine but even on a hot day the water is very cool. The beach was beautiful to walk along and explore. Heaps of people enjoying being outdoors.

clifton beach. evening visit is nice to have the diffrent colours of sun on the backdrops of mountain,every moment of sunset is beutiful
full moon day visit is so nice as the sun and moon are visibale in almost same size
very beutiful

A beach straight out of the Riviera.. Driving to Camps Bay from Sea point you can see part of the beach and if you are a tourist will probably drive on by as there is little parking on the road above. But if you keep driving there are parking lots of the left and on the sea side of the road steps leading down to the beach. Clifton is an affluent suburb and the area around Clifton beach has some of the most expensive properties in South Africa, unlike some overseas countries the beaches are not private so the poorer people can take a walk along them or just lie and take in the sun. I recommend Clifton 4th beach this is the one closest to Camps bay. this beach is the widest of all 4. In 2004 it was rated as one of the top 10 beaches in the world. The beach has the Blue flag status so it must be clean and up to standard. The beaches are separated by huge white granite boulders and some of the houses skirting the beach seem to grow out of the boulders. The sand is as white as it gets as its made from pure white granite that has been ground down over hundreds of years. Off shore there are large outcrops of white granite boulders 4 meters high and the smaller one have seals suntanning on them. and its a famous place for the rice and famous to moor their bay liners off. If you are there on a clear day you can see the cable car going back and forth from table mountain which towers over head. There are life savers on hand but if your a warm water person you wont need them the water is freezing! The day we were there only two tourists ventured into the waves. In summer just be warned there can be Blue bottle in the water or as the rest of the world knows them "Portuguese men of war" which is a type of jelly fish with a long tail with small stinging venom needles and can be very painful. There are no bars on the beach so bring your own food and drink. There are men's and ladies ablutions which are quite clean and don't smell like your usual beach ablutions. We visited in Autumn and the beach wasn't the busy but I believe in December it can become a bit over bearing with crowds.
Amazing beach!. More of an upscale part of Cape Town, but very scenic and beautiful! Very rich looking houses with fancy pools and fancy cars in this part of town.

World Class. One of Cape Towns best an absolute favorite for locals .one long beach divided into four by rocks,each with its own stairs from the road down.Although the water can be cold ,it does not deter from the beauty and spectacular views of the sea and the mountain.These are the beaches to be seen at .

Enjoyed More than Camp's Bay. Loved these beaches. Found them much more relaxing and enjoyable compared to Camp's Bay because people weren't trying to sell you something or bother you for money every few minutes. Much more relaxing.

Great if you like to sunbathe or people watch. Cape Town's most popular beach, clean and a bit regulated, lined with restaurants and small hotels. If you are a casual visitor, parking can be a problem.

Red Hot Sun, Freezing Ocean. This beach is made up of pur white sand and a relatively gentle Ocean lapping up to your feet. Don't be fooled. The water is truly freezing. There are lots of trendy restaurants and coffee shops lining the roads alongside the beach. A slight irritation are the beach vendors. They are merciless and will approach you every 10 minutes or so even though you've refused to buy anything off them on the previous 20 or so times that they've approached you.

Great Beach In A Sheltered Bay. We stopped by on our way down to the Cape. The beach is located in a sheltered bay surrounded by some expensive homes. Looks like a nice, safe area.Didn't get to spend much time on the actual beach, but it looks clean and well maintained.
Private beach feel.. Be aware many steps down to this lovely beach overlooked by the beautifull mansions nestled on the cliffs of Clifton.

Lovely afternoon . Walked along all 4 clifton beaches and found a relatively quiet spot. Beaches were less busy and nicer than camps bay beach which is also very good. Parking easy on road side but lots of stairs to climb down. Take snacks and water as no shops. Beaches are very unspoilt. Easy to find shade behind the boulders on the beach.

Windprotected. we had some relaxing hours on the 3rd beach during our visit in CT. As the beach is protected by the surrounding bay it's very windless (particularly compared to Campy Bay). It's possible to hire beach chairs and sunshades if you like it more comfy. The guys walking arround for selling drinks can be a bit annoying...
Booom !. I would suggest the 3rd beach which is protected from the wind. If you wanna dive...go straight to the ocean and don't even think about coldness :)
Lovelly beaches. Lovelly beaches with amazing views. The combination of beach with the mountain on the back. Do not miss.

Peaceful afternoon on Clifton 2nd. We spent a Monday afternoon on Clifton 2nd enjoying the sunshine and beautiful views. Obviously, the water is too cold for most people to want to swim in, but dipping your feet in and splashing around a bit will definitely cool you off! The beach was quiet and calm, with just a few people around. The view is great and I enjoyed looking at all the amazing houses on the cliffs there. There is a shower and people renting chairs and umbrellas and selling water, soda, ice cream, beach toys and snacks, but they are not intrusive. It's quite convenient considering the stairs you'd have to take back up to the road.

One of the most beautiful beaches I've visited!. My favorite was Clifton 3rd but they are all beautiful. The cove keeps the wind out so you are able to enjoy a peaceful beach day. Clifton 3rd has parasols & lounge chairs for rent at a very reasonable price and you can bargain with them if you want several of each. Although the beach area is very small and there are a lot of people, it did not feel crowded. People are very considerate and respect each other's space. Several times we went to different beaches but would always leave after a few minutes to return to Clifton 3rd! There are bathrooms and showers and men walking around selling water and food if need. Also, the bus stop is right in front of the parking lot. My only negative experience was the traffic going home. We were there during New Years Eve so the roads were very busy. If we did not arrange for a taxi ahead of time, it was impossible to find an empty one. Even all the buses were filled to max capacity and could not stop. So if you're not driving, make sure you have a taxi drivers card, or call your hotel to arrange a pick-up 30-45min before you're ready to leave.

Beautiful to see.... We were told, the Clifton Beaches are "the place to be seen". We just enjoyed seeing them. The beaches are beautiful, white sand with mountains all around and some large, smooth rock outcroppings. Great place to sit and look/relax.

Sunday morning hang out. Clifton beach can get very busy on weekends. Parking may be a problem at some point in the day. The beach itself is very clean and enchanting. I love the huge rock outcrops that sort of divide the beach into sections.There is a good view of Lion's head from Clifton and this looks way more dramatic as the tide comes in. The waves crash against the rocks and the spray looks amazing in the morning sun.It is a nice beach to play or just bask and even play with your dog. I was there on a Sunday morning and I fell in love with the place. I even got to do a fashion shoot there.

Play beach tennis here and relax. There are 4 beaches named as Clifton 1, 2, 3, and 4. You need to know what exactly you want. Swimming is secondary preference for Capetonians as water is very cold but you must learn from them to enjoy at beaches.
beautiful. I love beaches. Clifton is amongst some of the finest in the world that I have visited before. 10/10 would bang.
Scenic Drive and nice beaches. Spend a little time driving to the beaches. Stay if you want and enjoy a perfect day. Great way to while away time and enjoy the surf.

The luxury in cape town area. Happy few living there.... There are only few areas in the world with such an environment. You feel good there but is it a dream or a reality ? I don't know but I like it so much.

Loved It. Great beach that offers scenic landscapes. I love the beauty that this place has to offer. It can be over crowded at times but definitely a must do if you are in Cape Town. We go to Cape Town yearly, and this is still one of my favorite spots. Hooray for summer days.

2nd best beach in the world. Nothing beats the amazing beach. The atmosphere is relaxed and the beach is kept clean to a high degree.
This beach welcomes all with open arms, Peach,chocolate,caramel people even Gay and straight.
The crowd is totally diverse and has an easy going feel to it. Best to go on a Sunday afternoon.
Its a gem in Cape Town.
Beautiful beach. Quiet beach but can become windy at times. One can rent a bed and umbrella if required and hawkers come around selling drinks, ice cream etc which is handy!

Great place to people watch. V.cold water.. The beaches are really nice, but the water is very cold as it is on the atlantic coast. All the CT beautiful people come here to pose and it is a great place to sit and watch the world go by.

Venice Beach of Cape Town. Our tour guide told us this was the Venice Beach of Cape Town and I can now see why. The views are beyond amazing! I didn't dare step into the freezing water but the views were enough for me to be in awe!

Beautiful, but very cold sea. Clifton 1-4 beaches are beautiful and you can walk from one to the next. Lying in the sun with Table Mountain and Lion's Head on view is truly awesome. However, the sea is very cold so not suitable for swimming comfortably and there are steep steps getting down to the beach so it's not ideal for those with disabilities or pushchairs. Need to keep an eye on your valuables, but it felt safe overall and was a relaxing day in the sun.
Beautiful. Great beach for watching surfers, clean but a long walk down. Need to be fit! A shower on beach but no toilets

Beatiful beaches. The scenic view is amazing. The variety of nearby restaurants is an advantage.Usually have very relaxing days at the beach .... sometimes it becomes a bit overcrowded in the peak time.

Clifton is nice, but there is crime. Clifton 1st - 4th beaches are great to look at and hang out for sunsets, but there are loads of sketchy people roaming the beaches looking for cell phones, wallets etc. to steal, so watch your stuff.
Greatest beach in WC. Greatest beach to visit in Western Cape. Great views sand and you can rent chairs and umbrellas. Worth the drive.

Nice beach. a beautiful beach where you can chill and enjoy the sun. The water is freezing, but if you are there during the summer (October - April) you will definitely go for a swim. to get to the beach you have to take the stairs!
Wind free. Wonderful clean beach, away from the busier camps Bay Area and sheltered from the wind. Really relaxing time on the beach.

Beautiful quiet beaches. The Clifton beaches are only 25 minutes away from downtown Cape Town.
white sand and gigantic rocks dominate the beach.
There is a lay-back atmosphere. Good lounge bars with relaxing ocean views,.

Loved travelling to Cape Town in South Africa . Fantastic beautiful beaches and bars around this area.Great trendy place to be. Highly recommend just be cautious of pick pockets. Bare in mind the contrast of rich and poor in Cape Town. I found this sad and hard how rich some people are and how poor and hard up living in squalor some others were. Big contrast.Beautiful place though :)

great local beaches. Next to camps bay it's a tough choice between the beaches. Camps bays has lots of shops and restaurants but has no protection from the wind, whilst the reverse is true for Clifton. Clifton also has a more local feel to it. Go to both if you can!

Beautiful Clifton Beach. One of the most beautiful clean beaches to sit on and enjoy the sunshine... The only thing not so nice is not being able to swim unless you dont mind the icy cold water of the Atlantic ocean!

beautiful beaches. The sand here is super white and it contrasts great with the turquoise waters, all of this coupled with table mountain looming over you, you have an amazing beach. If only the water was a bit warmer, and this is from someone who doesn't mind cool water. Two of my friends wouldn't even get in the water at all. We had a good time and got some sun, lovely beach but it got rather crowded.Didn't have to park as we took the bus.

Pure white sand. It's a tanning beach but if you don't mind freezing your toes then by all means swim, lol. There are days when the water is warmer and swimming longer is pleasant but for most days a quick dip is all I can manage. The road is way up above the beach and there are lots of stairs to get down there - so if you don't like stairs go further along the road to Camps Bay beach rather. I love Clifton because you can't see or hear the traffic, you are surrounded by big boulders, houses of the lucky few who live there and greenery. When you walk on the dry sand do a forward stomp movement when you walk...the sand is so clean closer to the shore it actually squeaks. There is first, second, third and fourth beach. I've only ever been to third and fourth beach - it get jam packed in summer so go early. Changing rooms and toilets get progressively dirty through the day because of the crowds, I always take my own tissues coz often they will run out of loo paper, which really irritates me. ( I always need to know there's a loo nearby wherever I go coz liquids go straight through me) Ice lolly and cold drink sellers patrol the beach all day - so no need to pack your own, theirs is ice cold. Don't leave your things unattended - in SA, I hate to admit, opportunistic thieves are aplenty so always be vigilant- I usually use my bag as my pillow and put my shoes under the foot end of my towel. Your photos will look amazing coz most days the sea is turquoise or azure blue. You can get there on the MyCiti bus from town.
Beautiful area, wonderful beaches. Classic city beaches surrounded by beautiful people, lovely properties but very cold water! Clifton beaches need a car and parking might be a problem.
White Sand. White clean sand and turquoise waters make this a little like the Med in Summer. Road side parking so dont leave too much in the car. A fabulous day on the Beach!

Just go. Beautiful beaches, clear water, clean sand. And you can sometimes see dolphins and whales. What's not to love?? We actually stayed in some apartments across the street to Clifton Beaches, so it was an easy trek. Great place to stay!

Early morning or sunset. Given a hot summer's day Clifton should be avoided. It's packed with millions of people - all enjoying themselves. But not for me. I prefer to take to the beach in the early morning when the municipal staff are cleaning up for the day or the evening when the last people are packing up. Crossing from first across to fourth beach with the cold water crashing onto the sand is a pleasure that needs to be enjoyed with only a few people.It's a good way to finish off the day..........
b'ful beach. It is one of the most posh areas of central cape town.There are four beaches and the fourth one is the best.ocean looks b'ful and beaches are indeed very fine.wonderful place to relax.
Nicely secluded. Love these beaches as they are sheltered from the wind and divided in between the four of them.No need to bring umbrellas or drinks as there are plenty vendors wanting your business.

Beautiful white sandy beach set on magnificent rocks. Great relaxing beach with very good access from road, where you will find some of the world's most beatiful homes. The beach is Extremely clean, yet pet friendly. You can chill there for an entire day!...
On our city tour Clifton. Since I lived in Clifton, New Jersey USA it was exciting to see a town called Clifton in Africa. It is right off the beach which is gorgeous. The homes were beautiful.

an entire coast of paradise on the other side of the mountain. I would give these beaches a big fat 5 star rating. it couldn't be more beautiful there. and often one of the only places protected by that crazy Cape Town south-Easter in January. Clifton and Camps Bay are also great in the evenings for picnics, and the occasional summer event or competition. I live on the other side of the mountain and i visit camps bay and Clifton whenever i can for a change of scenery- it never gets old! The only reason why I can't give these beaches a 5 is that the water is more often than not Freeeezing.

Beautiful Beach. The 4 Clifton beaches are like one big beach, just a bit separated through big rocks. You can go for a walk and just watch out what's the best for you. The place between second and third beach is very nice. The water is very clear, just wonderful! At third and fourth beach you will have very very soft sand. Public toilets are also available, a cafe at fourth beach as well.

Stunning. Mid week visit at end of January and surprisingly quiet. Amazing views and great to dream about living in the adjacent houses.
Located just a short drive from Cape Town, worth a visit for a change from Camps Bay etc
Great walk along the beaches!. These beaches are gorgeous - easy to find a spot and lots of umbrellas and chairs for rent! A great way to spend the day.
Stunning beach. It was a bit cold in October when we went, but the locals were enjoying the water nonetheless. Beautiful beach to lounge about in the sand or sit on the big rocks and watch the tides.
Great View. We visited this wonderful beach on a sunny saturday afternoon. The ocean and mountain views were marvellous. The sand is great. Try it, you will enjoy it.

Maybe I am a prude?. The sea and sand are so beautiful as they are in the West Cape. January, when I visited is not a good month to go to this beach,Very crowded.AS I said I am not a prude, not homophobic, but found the site of gays parading up and down stark naked unsettling.This is not recomended for kids.There is a time and place for evrything.

Beautiful, stylish beaches. The Clifton beaches are more interesting and stylish, as well as being more frequented by locals, than Camps Bay. No cafes or toilets though. Big boulders and 4 interconnected beaches reached at low tide.

Clifton Beach. We went to Clifton Beach, section 3, since it was suggested to us that we will enjoy it because there was less wind than other beaches nearby. I enjoyed it and got a great tan. Hopefully, they will build a bathroom in all 4 sections of the beach instead of just one.
Windy!. Windy but that's Cape Town, long beach with a great backdrop of the mountains - Stunning! Loads of restaurants to choose from.

Beautiful. Our family enjoyed visiting the Clifton Beaches. They were so beautiful and accommodating. The water was just the right temperature for how warm it was that day. Everyone on the beach was having a great time. Would definitely return.
See how the other half live!. Lovely clean beaches back with fantastic houses. The sea comes in and makes a fantastic display. Well worth a look.
Still the Best. Add Camps Bay and you have some of the besy beaches in the World. There is limited parking and we recommend the MyCiti bus service. It is excellent, regular and inexpensive.

Number 3. Great sandy beaches, we spend a few hours at number 3 which is also popular with gay couples but don't let this scare you off we thought it was a nice mix of people. The entrances are through steep staircases between residential houses.
Hollywood Beaches. This destination, I felt as if I was in Hollywood, it was stunning, with apartments set in the mountains and the beaches in front.
Stunningly beautiful beaches. Reminds me a lot of Northern California. The people are nice and friendly. Beautiful people and regular people all enjoying the hot weather.

Work it baby.... We only went once to Clifton so we're not as qualified to review them as other people, but on an early January morning we had a blast. We walked down to Clifton 1 then across to Clifton 4 which is an easy 5-10 minute walk. The sea was fairly warm for Clifton, which meant bloody freezing but not wetsuit-worthy. The poseurs were are work or in bed so the vibe was very chilled, the sun scorching, the backdrop better than Hollywood. Happy days.
Great beach day in CPT.... Do as the locals and spend the weekend on the beach during summer... pretty beach, good eye candy, amazing views... a nice local experience...

Tranquil. Clifton has its beaches numbered 1-4 and separated by rock formations, The beaches are small, more secluded than Camps Bay, however the views are spectacular with the crystal clear, but cold water in front of you, and the mountains behind. We went to Clifton #3, which is supposedly protected from the wind and where the "pretty" people hangout. The beach was spotless (no trash), with beautiful white sand. It seemed to have a good mix of people, and from those we conversed with, seemed friendly as well. Great place to chill! Warning: you have to go down quite a few stairs to get to the beach. Definitely not for wheelchairs, or people with walking disabilities.

No Better Place to Watch The SunSet. The clifton beaches are just awesome and have sand rocks and almost privacy, even though there may be so many other people on the beaches. When the sun goes down behind the rocks it looks just great and there are not many better places to be in Cape Town.
Love it.. Always love the feel of the forth beach. Great mix of folks and genders of all likings. Always clean and presentable, great sand quality.

Go to Camps Bay!!. Clifton Beaches are great if you like it quiet, but Camps Bay is where the action is...and the views. Plus there are a score of fantastic bars, and the best seafood restaurant in Cape Town, just a few metres away. You also have to go down to the beaches in Clifton, which can be pain. Not so in Camps Bay...just stroll across the street.

Excellent Beach with a great vibe.. This beach is breath taking with turquoise waters and white sandy beaches. It is one of the best beaches in Cape Town. A great place to swim or just bathe in the sun. The atmosphere is colourful and something to be part off. Great place to relax and unwind.

Best beach in Cape Town . This is my favourite beach in South Africa. Water is icy cold but the atmosphere on the beach is cool and on hot says the cold water is appreciated. Not too windy like some of the other beaches. You also have cool views of the mountains around you. Parking is a problem most of the time so on days with good weather I would suggest you go early.

Trendy but cold. Clifton beaches are all spectacular. The real issues with these beaches are the obvious cold water, but also that in being so popular, parking is a mission and traffic on the main road can be a nightmare. Its worth a visit if you are a tourist, but if you are looking for something a bit more special head to Muizenberg where swimming is better, Boulders for some personality, or the quieter beaches of Llundudno and Sandy Bay.
Ambience. Eventhough there was a shark warning this did not damper the mood and festive atmosphere on this beach
Perfect. These four beaches are the ones to use on windy days, as the rocks protect you from the gusts. Great Fun, especially as people come down in the late afternoon, with cool boxes and picnics.

Busy, busy but lots of choice.. A very busy set of sandy beaches due to the proximity to the city, plenty of space to sunbath & you can rent loungers/parasols etc.Parking is not always easy - sometimes you can just be lucky. We find that the area is best avoided on sunny weekend afternoons if you're driving. There are other options such as the new route from the city or the open top tourist bus.Lovely for a morning stroll as long as you don't mind dogs, there are lots. Plenty of cafes, bars & restaurants along the strip so these is lots of choice throughout the day & night. For quieter options head on around the coast, watch the kite surfers at llandudno or enjoy the swathes of sand around Hout Bay.

Great beaches but overcrowded. We didn't manage to get down to the beach as there was no parking and the place was crowded, go early in the morning for a chance of parking or a good beach spot or use the sightseeing Cape town service.

Brilliant suburban. Clifton is the jewel of the Cape. The setting is as scenic as you can find anywhere in the world. It has the wonderful benefit that it is never windy. Even with a howling south easter, the beach is still sheltered. All the facilities are there: cool drinks and ice cream served on the beach, loungers and umbrellas and ablution facilities, and bus service.If you are going to a beach, it must be this one.
Beautifullllll. One of the best place in Cape Town, Sun and beach, What else? Just take care, one of my friend lost his shoes
Hot sun , can't swim . This beach only looks good in pictures , the ocean is icy cold and dangerous to swim in and the sun beats down unrelentingly , very unpleasant

Gorgeous Beach, Freezing Cold Water. The beach is clean and stunning, and people walk around selling drinks, which is convenient. Unless you are a polar bear or penguin, the water is too cold for an enjoyable swim.
Cool beaches without wind. You can't go to Cape Town without trying the clifton beaches. They are really cool. Another pré is that there are not only tourists there, but also a lot of locals.

4the beach is the best. Clifton beach consists of four sections, from 1st beach to fourth beach. I like fouth beach the most as there is a nice shadding near the large rocks. The water is colder that Fishhoek beach. It's a nice place to catch a wave and relax afterwards.
Nice nice. We had a stroll on the beach at sunset... Awesome view and it is really child-friendly and safe. Would go again

A Perfect Day. Clifton is and has always been an idylic location for sunbathers, surfers and even the odd swimmer. Ablutions, Sun decks and umbrella's are readily available. Simply Idylic for a perfect day at the beach.

Clifton beach - Atlantic Ocean . Clifton is home to 4 beaches that are very popular during the summer months due to them being sheltered from the South Easterly wind that will blow out most beaches in Cape Town . This is also where you will find some of the most expensive real estate in South Africa . There is a walk down to the beach via steps and if you are fat and lazy Clifton is not for you . The water is cold as you would expect on the Atlantic coast line and is a beach where people come to see and be seen . It's a beach where you can tan and people watch . If you are looking for bars beers and warm water and food try Ibiza . If you are looking for a beautiful part of the Cape coast line try Clifton . There are no food outlets , or retail shops of any kind although vendors do sell soft drinks on the beach .
Beautyful. Clifton 1-4 are beautiful beaches with a very quiet atmosphere. White sand as well as turquoise blue water remind of Carribean Island. Very clean.

Stunning Clean Beach Ideal for a lazy afternoon. The beaches are impeccably clean and safe. Ideal to spend a lazy afternoon in the sun with a glass of wine. Just sit and relax and take in the coastline. Not too crowded as well which means you can choose a nice quiet spot.

Exquisitely beautiful. Clifton is one of the most beautiful spots in Cape Town. It's great for the scenery and lounging about on the sandy beach, but it's rather impractical as the sea is always freezing cold (especially in summer due to upwelling and wind) and therefore swimming isn't pleasant. It's perfect for windy days as the beach is well sheltered by the large boulders. Cape Town can get extremely windy in Dec/Jan, so Clifton is a great spot to visit on the windy days! It can also be pricey - hiring an umbrella is about R40, and sun loungers are R60 each. There are no places to buy food, although vendors sell cold drinks and ice-creams on the beach.
An idylic beach. A series of little beaches close to the city. Intimate and interesting. Especially nice at sun down. Water is VERY cold though - speedos not recommended
Beautiful, clean beaches. These beaches were beautiful. You get quite hot sitting on the beach but unfortunately the water is too cold to swim in, even in summer apparently.

Stunning stretch of sand. Clifton is a must for beachlovers, but be prepared for the cold Atlantic sea…almost always guaranteed a wind free visit, Clifton is one of the best beaches that one can find in the world.

Semi private small beaches. Clifton beaches are small beaches and can only be accessed by steep steps, so obviously not an option for the elderly or families with small children. Camps Bay, close by, is a better option for these groups of people but if you want a semi private beach for topless tanning, these beaches are a good option. Freezing water all year round as this is the Atlantic Ocean so swimming is only for the brave.
"Be there or Be square". Fab bars across the road from the beach with most offering sea views -The vibe really pumps is the entire area and gets very busy when the sun is out

Wind free beach. Great place if the wind is blowing as it's sheltered.Definitely the place to see and be seen in Cape Town. Unfortunately the Benguela current means the water although beautiful is bone chillingly cold.There are no restaurants at Clifton but walk 10mins next door to Camps Bay for the best sundowners on the strip there.
BEAUTIFUL. go here and take in all the beauty that cape town has to offer!! With white sand beaches, clear blue water, and views of table mountain, this entire area is absolutely stunning!!!
3rd beach. liked: clean and safedisliked: would be better to have some mini-cafe near the beach, water-ice cream sellers are always walking around the people and it makes headache
great Facility. I loved it.. So many hot guys too and they were all so friendly. I made many friends for special party.

Nice beach out of the wind.. Pity it was too cold to be in swimwear. Of course, not very crowded at that time the year. Every one told me to come back in dec. Topless tanning is authorized which is good for my tan marks. The only other beach in SA where it is authorized is camps bay. Will be back.
Worth it. There are many of these small beaches throughout the cape peninsula. All of them are great to visit or to see from a far.

Sunset at Clifton. A most beautiful stretch of beach on the Atlantic seaboard which is the perfect place to watch the african sunset . It is a close walk from Sea Point/Bantry Bay and connected to the Camps Bay which is equally amazing. The Breath taking white sand beach was immaculately clean but too cold to swim. Found some restaurant up on cliff which has the best Greek salad. Enjoyed one of the best sunset ever, this is a must not miss when you are in Cape Town!
Beautiful Sand. Amazing white beach sand lined with stunning restaurants and a blue ocean view. Water is a little cold.
Stunning urban oasis. So close to the city, easy access via hop on hop off bus. Recommend a pit stop here... Don't forget the sunscreen

Beautiful. Beautiful golden sands. Bit of a climb, by steps down and up, but well worth it. Plenty of sunscreen required, ocean was freezing. Local vendors selling water, ice cream etc, they're not too pushy
Great. The drive to Clifton is amazing. White sands. You will enjoy being there. Only downside is that you will swim in the Atlantic Ocean. The water is very cold.

Probably the best beach in the area C4. Fantastic views, white sand with loungers and shades for rent at tolerable prices. There were a few hawkers on the beach but not intrusive. No alcohol allowed so you might as well have their ice cream.With the wind in right direction it is very sheltered and pleasant enough to tempt you in for a swim. Brass monkeys should be careful about this activity.

These looked nice from the bus. Some of the coastline is very rocky, but the Clifton Beaches do have some sand areas that look clean and pleasant to stop at. This is somewhere you could bathe, but not necessarily to go into the sea. We did not do this as we were passing on the City Tour bus.

one of the most beautiful. this is one of the best beaches in South Africa. has a good crowd always. apart from the lovely beach theres lovely restaurants across the beach. can have lots of fun on a beautiful summers day. good and enjoyable whether single or with the family

Lovely beach. Clifton is an extremely beautiful part of the Cape Town coastline. Along the scenic drive along the coast, it is highly recommended to stop and take a walk on Clifton Beach. Beautiful views, lovely houses in the cliffs and some great restaurants as well.

Awesome beach, awful parking !. The beach is really beautiful, there are a lot of people which is fun (can be annoying for some people though !). The only bad sides are that you have to take something to get some shade if you stay a long time and take a cab or bus to come because parking your car can be really tricky.

The best of beach life!. The Clifton beach sand is so white and fine that you need sunglasses on a sunny day or you miss seeing the most beautiful people on the most impressive beaches of Cape Town. Eveb the water temperatures are ok in summer when you compare to Camps Bay. A must to see!

A well maintained seafront. The beach are is great for walking or just relaxing and watching the ocean waves. Beautiful sunset view. The high cliffs and the projecting apartment buildings gives the area an added beauty. This is one of the few places where I have found surface parking lot on the roof top connected to the road and the apartments below it.

Beautiful!. Beautiful beaches, but in the restaurants a little bit snobistic.
The food is also very good and we saw a lot of whales in the ocean at Clifton! Unforgetable was that...
Amazing view. Lovely background and views of the beach houses withe the white sanded beach ... But again as in south africa the water of the ocean is extreeeeeeeeemly cold
Beautiful!!!. The views are amazing. The beaches are neat and uniform with the matching umbrellas and sun deck chairs. Gives the beach class and added beauty.
Clifton beaches 1,2.3 and 4. lovely beaches, steep access, but for the agile, certainly worth the descent and more importantly, the climb back up.

Too crowded during the festive season. The beach and restaurants,live shows at the theatre opposite the beach.
Very difficult to get parking. Not a good idea just to walk in any hotel restaurant or a private one. Book ahead always jam packed.

My favourite. Clifton has four beaches which accommodate everybody's taste. This is my favourite beach, because you find a lot of windy days in Cape Town and Clifton is almost always windfree. You can hire an umbrella and chairs if you do not have your own. There are also local guys selling refreshments on the beach. Sometimes you can have a massage on the beach. This is definitely the best beach with beautiful views
A little crowded but fun non the less. White sand, crystal blue water and people having fun left right and center. A great vibe for a summer day and chilled romantic views at sunset. Beautiful!
Surfs up!. Great surf and on good weather days this is the place to be for sunbathing, umbrellas and ice cream. Very popular!

Perfect for wind-free days. When the wind is howling in Cape Town, head to Clifton. The beaches are not as full as Camps Bay as it is more difficult to get there were loads of stairs. Parking might be in issue in Clifton during summer. The best is to be dropped off by taxi or if you own a scooter.

Clean Beach; Clean water. The beach and water was clean.
But it was our first experience of cape town waters.
It was very cold.
We went on a not so clear and sunny day; so it was a bit of a spoiler for us.
On road car parking can be tricky at peak times.

Great for an evening/sundowner walk. The beaches and promenade at Clifton are well know for the evening vibe - considering the cold temp of the sea not the ideal swimming spot although if you can brave it...go for it.

For the beautiful people. The white sands of Clifton are filled with gorgeous bodies, one can feel a bit intimidated if you're on the chubby side. The water is freezing, parking is an issue and the walk down is a bit of a schlep. But it's a must visit

Back to Clifton. Being a weekday, end of the winter, the beach was quiet, clean and beautiful. 5 of our group of 10 went in the water .... brrr. Close proximity to good lunch restaurants, sitting on the terrace in warm sunshine .... can't beat it!
Clifton. Very nice area. Nice beach. Peace and quiet. We just passed by because the tour did not include it, but its very lovely place.

4 beaches to chose from. Clifton beaches are 4 beaches separated by large boulders. I have only been to 2, 3 and 4; the last one being my favourite. All are nice and sandy but the waters were freezing cold. I have been told by the locals that the westcoast waters are usually cold because of the currents from the south. But regardless, the beaches are vere pleasant and enjoyable.

Clifton Beaches Cape Town SoAfrica. Recommend a tour of the beach drive. I booked a tour with Thompsons and very glad I did. Traveling solo. I was joined by three couples from different parts of the world Fun! Our tour guide was a native SoAfrican and had a wealth of information. Our tour included a boat trip to Seal Island, lunch stop and viewing the Penguins. Or,,,, if you just want to talk the beaches this is the place to do it! You may even see a celebrity
My favorite beach!. Clifton 4th beach is my favorite beach to go to on a sunny day. White sand and blue waters with the mountain in the back. Best beach by far!

Beautiful and Ice Cold. Beautiful beaches,clear waters and sand. If you are a fan of the sea i guess you could swim but its ice cold! Not so full during this time but always be weary of your personal belongings.
Romantic Capetown. Clifton beache is wonderful, great place, lots of bars and good food & wines. Meet lovely peple from Capetown, the so called "Black Diamands".

Wonderful beach with contemporary architecture. In front the wonderful Clifton beach and the wild ocean.
Behind wonderful contemporary villas. Fine sandy beach, only few salesmen of icecream, sunglasses, hats or whatever... compared to other beaches. Water is freezy... but swimming possible. If you want to stay longer, you need a wetsuit.

Beautiful. Picturesque. Blue waters, stunning views. A beach not to be missed. Cool water. Clean beach.
One of the most famous beaches in Cape Town

Worth a visit, lovely beach and town. Stop off here on the Red/Blue bus. Plenty to look around in the sea front town and the beaches are lovely. If you have kids this would be a great place to let them play in the sand and water, and maybe an ice-cream.

most amazing beaches, maybe in the world. I am a regular on the beach and have travelled to europe and lived in the USA and have seen very few beaches that compare. There are 4 beaches, each with its own atmosphere. The beach requires a "little" hike as it is below the road. 4th beach, because it has the fewest stairs, tend to be the family beach. The swimming is certainly the safest and best on this beach and on summer weekends there are also a mass of boats parked off the beach. 3rd beach is the gay beach. Lots of gorgeous looking men and women2nd beach is the most fashionable with the younger (18-32) crowd. Also lots of gorgeous people on this beach. It is also a beach bats haven with some regulars coming down every day, winter and summer, when the weather is even close to acceptable, to play bats, cards and just hang.first beach has the most stairs and has an eclectic crowd which is a mix of people that own apartments above the beach and older capetonian regulars. This is also the only beach were it is legal to bring dogs and allow them off leash. This can be unpleasant for some.
jet set beach!!. cozy town, very trendy , good restaurants, beautiful beach, beautiful shopstores. Elton John has a house in Cliffton

Cars parked on rooftops. We went along the coast on the open top bus and didn't stop. It was interesting to see the houses of the wealthy with private lifts and cars parked on roof tops. There are 4 beaches but none of them very spectacular but then I live in Australia with the best beaches in the world!

Best beach in Capetown. Visited Camps Bay beach. A nice little beach with good sand although the sea is a bit on the cold side. A safe area, both in and out of the water and there are plenty of good places to eat opposite the beach.

Lovely spot but just a small beach. No regrets on stopping here but would not go out of my way to do this. We drove here and spent 30 minutes. Probably a good spot for a picnic and a place for the kids to play in the sand.
Crisp , clean and white. The beaches are beautifully kept and white , water cold most times of the year , but summers it's swimmable , magnificent views

Good restaurants. The beach was beautiful and filled with beautiful people which made the average person (like me) feel a bit uncomfortable. But the resturants where great. Traffic was an issue and so was parking. I recommend taking the hop on hop off bus or a taxi so you don't have to worry about finding a car park.
Beautiful Scenery. The beach scenery is amazing although the day we were there it was a bit cold and windy. On a warmer day it would have been a great place to walk.
More beautiful than it looks like on a picture. It is a very beautiful beach. It is a pity that we only stayed there for a shor time. And didn't have enough time to admire it and enjoy it.
Nice View. We went there with the Hop on Hop off bus so we stayed for few hours, we had lunch on one of the restaurants that are there, it was a slow service but we enjoy it.
World Class. No more needs to be said about these beaches, spectacular - except for the cold water . . . . :)......
Clifton where the beautiful sun themselves. Trendy small beach almost in a cove -close to the city with fine white sand and clear blue sea. Where the beautiful people go.

Cape Town's Beaches. South Africa especially Cape Town can compete with the World believe me.We have the most amazing beaches...mountain ranges and most spectacular views.Clifton Beaches have the sea and the mountain and not forgetting shopping and restaurants all in one!!!Visit our beaches even during Winter... we can assure you a ball of a time!!!

Bliss!!. Clifton has 4 beautiful beaches.. So wether you are a family or wants some solitude there's a spot for you!!. These beaches are so popular that's is packed by 10am every day during the summer months. Parking is a downside and there's loads of steps down to the beach.
Blue flag beaches. If you can stand the cold water, Clifton is the place to be. A selection of four different beaches to have fun on and check out the views
protected beaches. there are 4 separate bays each with it's own character. A good place to escape the "cape doctor" Down side are the many stairs to carry beach apparel.

Nice place to visit. The beach is split into 4, with beach 1 being for family, and beach 4 the 'place to be seen'. We walked and sat on all of them, and liked beach 2 the best. The water is clear, and waves are pretty good. Beware that in spring the water is very cold! The only difficulty was that there are no shops or cafes at all near the beach; take water/food with you. Also most of the entrances to the beach are down steps, so might not have the best accessibility
breath taking. went here with my family for vacation and the place is simply breath taking. one of the beaches to be preserve. there are pipis also good to use as a bait for fishing.
riches. Obviously this is the place for the rich and famous. The beach are real nice. Only a short visit will do.

Beautiful landscape. Some of the most beautiful beaches I have seen. Unfortunately for me even in summer the water was cold so cold, but it's worth every minute spent there. love this place, the sand, the ocean and the mountain....priceless

Simply stunning. The beaches are incredibly clean and the ocean beautifully blue. No wonder its always on the list of top beaches in the world. Please note parking is scarce so take the bus if possible and there are no shops nearby so you'll need to take everything with you!

Worth a day trip/tour especially in summer. Some of the most beautiful beaches I have seen, unfortunately in winter, so it was too cold to swim. The architecture along the way is incredibly impressive and winding coastal roads similar to The Great Ocean Road in Australia. The 12 Apostle Mountain range is one of the most beautiful landscapes I've seen, you'll need your best camera for this day trip.

The Jewel of the Cape. Clifton beaches (there are 4 all interlinked), are like nothing else. The sand is fine and brilliantly white. The water is clear, but cold. Second beach is the most popular, but each beach has its own different crowd making it easy to find one of the beaches that fits your mood or comfort. The beaches have a great vibe and as Clifton is one of the most sheltered areas in Cape Town, hardly ever have wind. A great place to visit in summer time.
Pristine wonderfull. So relaxing so very nice better beach anywhere ? I suppose so yet for me I ask for no moreVery good restaurants near by.Safe
Clean and Calming. I liked the cleanliness of the beach, the smooth sand and calmness of the place. I didn't like the cold waters.

Why are all the people beautiful on Clifton's beaches?. Must be due to all the stairs you have to climb to get to the beach and back.. Beaches always clean. Cape Town knows how to keep their city clean! Clifton a must. Always feel like the wind is a bit less on Clifton's side...or It might be my imagination

World Class. A word class setting with a choice of 4 coves or beaches (plus a hidden 5th)
Clifton is a Cape Town institution. Go out of season or for a candlit dinner to avoid the crowds and parking challenges!

Stunning Beach. Spent a few days on Clifton beach and it is beautiful. Very clean and well worth a visit. The mountains that surround the beach are gorgeous and I enjoyed watching the paragliders. The weather helped as that also was stunning.
Clean. Clifton js a great choice. Parking can be an issue on a sunny day. Good toilet facilities and generally a good crowd of people.
Posh!. Though the beach itself is nothing out of the ordinary, the surrounding areas are classy with cafes, boutique homes and the like. Good but wouldn't specifically go for this.
Almost deserted on a warm winters day. Lovely beaches with nobody around on probably the hottest winter day in CT. Excellent photographic opportunity with backlit rocks and sea.

Magnificent. Cape Towns beaches are all very beautiful - unfortunately the water is always so freezing. With its beautiful white, soft sand, Clifton and all Cape Towns other beaches are always good for a walk no matter the season
Relaxing time. The beaches are always clean and even though the water is freezing cold you can just relax and work on your tan. Clifton beaches is a great place to be when the sun sets.
Wonderful. The view is amazing, the sounds if the waves hitting the rocks is amazing too. Great time, good alternatives to take a couple of drinks and good food.

The most beautiful beaches in the world!!!. Clifton beaches are famous for their excellent position and shield the wind when the rest of the city is very windy!. The beaches are also separated into four beaches ...during high tide by the surf coming up high enough that the rocks divide the beaches....each one has a very different local crowd and also access is harder to get to on first beach....fourth beach feign easiest to access and therefore the family friendly beach with list of kids , umbrellas and beach paddle etc..... The beaches are small and intimate.....fourth being bigger.....but the setting with private homes right in the sand and the enclosed space so beautiful....you gave to pack your food and drinks and go spend a day. Parking is hard....it gets very crowded during holidays....and the ocean can sometimes be freezing cold.....but nevertheless you haven't been to a Cape Town if you haven't visited Clifton beaches!!

wind free beaches in cape town. cliftons 4 beaches is know for being wind free and it also makes them hot on a sunny day. but if you want to mingle with good looking people this is the place to be. very crowded on weekends and difficult to get parking after 11am

Iconic for views. Made up of 4 little beaches with iconic residences and sunsets Clifton along with Camps Bay & Llandudno makes up one of the few bathing beaches in Cape Town itself with sandy beaches. Staying opposite the sea in Cape Town can mean a beautiful but does not guarantee a bathing beach with sand as much of the coastline is rocky so check before booking.
exhilarating experience. the winding road, the beautiful houses along the way, the mist created by the proudly dashing waves have to experienced. words cannot describe the ride.

Sun sets / Blue hour. My husband and I went to Clifton Beaches in May 2014 during the beginning of winter. The weather was too cold to go swimming but it was beautiful to just watch the sun set and then see the blue hour. There are 4 parts to the beach and we mainly go our views from Beach 3. It was calming to hear the crashing waves and see the beautiful beach homes alongside the cliffs.

Top Beach. Clifton Beaches have white sands and blue clean sea. Safe. Security is good as their is a active visible policing around all the time. The water is cold what is the only reason I did not spend the whole day in the sea.

Out of this World Sunset Picnic. Sunset Picnics at Clfton No. 4 is an unbelievable experience, it is on the doorstep of Cape Town, there is no entrance fee and the view and experience is out of the world. One can easily imagine that one are on me of those top beaches normally found in tripadvisor. Take a jacket as it can get cold, take some candles as it can get romantic or just a lovely ambiance. Don't go if the weather is bad, turn around and go home so that you don't spoil and a possibly brilliant future experience. This is a place you take out of town visitors and watch them turn green with envy

Pristine white sand and epic views....!. Perfect spot to watch the bronzed local and foreign talent alike taking in the African sun whilst enjoying the magnificent views of the Atlantic ocean, Lions Head and the luxurious homes on top of the famous Clifton cliffs!

best part of summer. It might be a bit intimidating at first, but clifton is the perfect summer hangout. Extremely clean, very safe (i usually go alone and have left my bags while going into the water), great for picnics, usually have lots of guys selling water or soda. Almost never windy, even at night. Clifton4 has the best beachy vibe, but i prefer the 2nd and 3rd beaches. Only those stairs put me off a bit, but also keeps one in beach shape ;)

Clifton 2 is simply the best. Clifton 2 is the best. Go early on a sunny day as parking in this area is so tricky to find. Take a picnic basket or cooler bag filled with snacks, lunch and iced water as it's too far to find a lunch place.
Take it easy. Clifton 4th beach is a must on a hot summer evening in Cape Town, grab your picnic basket and a few friends or your partner for a fabulous night on the white sand.
A bit exaggerated. Apparently it is supposed to be very cool and beautiful there, but I'd rather go to Camps Bay, where you at least have shops, a promenade, shadow and cleaner water.

The world's best beach. If the weather is good, plan a trip to Clifton. The Beach has 4 separate beaches - Clifton 1,2,3,4 beaches. No 1 is closest to the City and has the steepest stairs. No 4 on the Camps Bay side has parking access and the fewest stairs. All beaches have food and drink hawkers and you can rent beach chairs on busy days. No 4 beach is patrolled by lifeguards and you can swim between the flag. Perfect for kids - But remember the water is super-cold. You'll see plenty of people standing around in the water up to their ankles, but not that many in the water!

Gorgeous !!. Sand is like white powder, waters are not too rough but still cold as it is the Atlantic Ocean. It is broken up into 4 beaches. 1st and 4th are the best in my opinion. The beach is at the bottom of the cliffs past the million dollar homes.

Nice beach, cold water. Very nice beaches. Every minute you're there, you're asked if you want an ice cream!!?? *%$##@ Eventually even bought one ;p. But it has comfortable sand to lie on. It has to! Because the sea is soooo cold… Nevertheless a nice beach near CT.
Fabulous beaches. A must to visit beautiful beaches and lots of very good restaurants and cafés.it is quite small but it was a stop on the hop on hop of bus so we hopped of for lunch and a vino

Awesome place for sun bathing & picnics. There are so many good things to say about Clifton Beach! Even though the 4 coves are small, there are nice spots to evade the ever present wind. It's great for children, great for tossing the frisbee and building sandcastles. The crowd is pleasant and therefore it makes for a nice safe spot to have an evening picnic. There are 4 coves, called 1st - 4th Beach. On 4th Beach you will find public toilets and a shower outside. Since it's on the Atlantic side of of Cape Town, expect a rather chilly water temperature. Camps Bay with a nice array of Café's, Ice Cream Parlours and Restaurants is short drive away to the south, as is Bantry Bay and Green Point to the city side. All in all, a beautiful place to spend the afternoon or evening and catch dinner + drinks afterwards close by.
paradise. A most beautiful stretch of beach on the Atlantic seaboard which is the perfect place to watch the african sunset .

world class. Whilst the water is rather cold, the beach is pristine and compares favourably to any of the worlds best beaches, facilities excellent. Parking is very safe with the whole road under camera surveillance.

Absolutely fantastic!!. I was there last year and i keep dreaming go back..The hills, the natural beauty and the colours of South Africa, italian styled houses, in such a remote part of the world..try to catch a sunset, it will be one of the most magic moments of your life, cobine it with a dinner to one of the exquisite restaurants..

Beautiful beach with protection from the wind on even the stormiest of days. A must. Clifton is "split up" into The First Beach, Second Beach, Third Beach and The Fourth Beach whereof The Fourth Beach offers the best protection from the wind. It is a bit of a "party beach" but fun for the whole family and you can just stay until the evening and watch the sunset.

Lifestyles of the rich and famous. Who wouldn't want to be on Clifton beach if you were rich and famous? It is clean, facilities are clean and it has perfect beach and ocean conditions. Parking is a huge problem if you get there by car.
beaches of extreme beautiful nature.. near to the heart of cape town city, but you need a taxi to go. the view is breath taking, if you want to swim, be ready for the cold ocean water.

One of the best locations in the world. Beautiful white beaches with a brilliant blue sea. Albeit a little cold water if you have come from Durban but a great place. Go to either Clifton 3 or Clifton 4.

My favorite beach in Cape Town. With views of the twelve apostles and the Atlantic Ocean, you can't go wrong in Clifton. Clifton consists of 1st, 2nd, 3rd, & 4th, with 4th being the most popular and busy to 1st being the more exclusive and quiet. Clifton is my favorite spot to sit back, relax, and enjoy soaking up the sun. :)

Best 4 beaches in the world at one location. Any sun seeker visiting Cape Town must visit one of the Clifton beaches. How the beaches work is basically as follows. There are 4 numbered beaches.Clifton 1 - Considered to be more for the Clifton localsClifton 2 - For the younger, liberal, hip crowd. Models wanting to get a tan come hereClifton 3 - Preferred by the gay communityClifton 4 - The largest of the beaches considered to be the family beach.However there is a Clifton "5"; a secret beach if you like, which only the locals know about and which I may cannot write about. Happy swimming.
Beautiful. Whole the coastline is really fantastic to experience. One beach more beautiful than the other and the scenery around makes one feel really relaxed
Stunning. Clifton Beaches consist of three different beaches, Clifton 1, 2 and 3. There are huge Rocks in the water and the whole scenery ist stunning.This is my favourit beach around Cape Town.
Stunning Beach. The most perfect spot to laze in the sun and enjoy a day at the beach. It is almost always wind free, so it doesn't matter is there is a gale blowing over the rest of the peninsula.

Spend the day but bring your own food. As a local from the suburbs, I was concerned about safety as I was bringing my two children without my husband. Once we made it down the many stairs with our heavy coolerbag, I realised I had nothing to fear. The lifesaving club was busy and the usual tourists and vendors were out in the sun, even on a crisp April morning. The men who rent their chairs were also there, to my surprise as I hadn't expected them out of season. We had a lovely morning, but forgot our sunblock so headed home too soon. Sadly we also encountered the dreaded blue bottles. As mentioned, we live in the 'burbs so had very little Atlantic Ocean knowledge to help us prepare for our visit. On the plus side, going out of season meant there was plenty of street parking; unheard of in the summer! We're looking forward to our next visit, sunblock in bag.

beach. it is one of the best beaches on the ocean, for me as a greek it is not something special because we have great sea, but the amazing thing is the colour of the water especially when you fly over by helicopter, it is a clean blue colour, not like the atlantic in europe where in the nederlands the colour is grey!!!!!!!
Very nice. Clifton Beach gives you the chance to chill out at white beaches and enjoy the ocean. Its very calm and clean!

Nice beach. This was a very nice beach. The water was beautiful but very cold. It was a hot day, so it was actually nice to take a quick dip. Vendors are nice when you need them, but if you're not buying then they can be annoying.
Stunning Beaches. These are four of the most beautiful beaches I have had the pleasure of visiting. Go early to avoid the crowds.

Imagine being better than you really are. surrounded by mansions, the sound of the ocean, some super yachts mooring, the view of Table Mountain and signal hill and probably the coldest water you could find. Sip some cold water or buy ice cream from the creative local sellers, imagine you are a movie star! Best to walk there and not spent most of your day looking for parking though

clifton 4th beach is my best. it is the most beautiful setting in cape town and especially with a south easterly very protected. just that there is no bar or restaurant is a pitty ! the vendors are nice people but a pain when they shout when you want to sleep !

Oh to be rich and famous ..... ..... well rich at any rate to be able to afford one of these beautiful homes overlooking the most perfect, sheltered beach. A picture postcard bay with plenty of interesting people to watch, shame the sea is so cold!

Heaven on Earth!. Just love Clifton's 4th beach. The large boulders on the left are a stunning feature may it be in sunshine, fog, moon-light or whatever other situation. I have seen dolphins frequently and the sand is very fine and almost white. On the health side: the steps returning to the street (particularly) or the parking will keep one in shape!

Clifton Beach. I love this beach!! Water is cold, but views are extraordinary! I've been on many beaches around the world and Clifton ranks right up there with the top! Restaurant up on cliff has the best Greek salad! No disappointments here!!
Amazing. Beautiful beach and must visit because it is also connected to the Camps Bay which is amazing. Breath taking white sand beach.

Four pretty little beaches. Clifton beaches are four very pretty little beaches and are very popular with the young jet setters. Definitely a place to don your swimmers and take in a few rays sit and people watch you never know who you may see.
Just wonderful. Just wonderful beaches. The water is cold but a LOT of surfing and sunbading. Close to nice restaurants. Its a do not miss when you are in Cape Town!

Hot. Liked the beach, it was clean and well organised with chair and umbrellas to hire. Disliked the parking which was almost non existent and the hawkers selling ice creams got a bit much though they were not persistant.

Love the beaches at Clifton.. Went on No 3 this time, really spent a lovely couple of hours down there, even saw Dolphins frolicking in the sea. Love this side of Cape Town and always visit when in SA.
Relatively Wind Free. Cape Town can be very windy, but unlike some of the beeches around, Clifton can be relatively wind free. Great family atmosphere at weekends

Way over-rated. Six kilometers from cape town.There are 4 Clifton beaches, I visited number 4 (Supposedly the best) and was not impressed.You have to go down a track/stairs between residential houses, then you get to the beach area, where there is nothing other than lying on the sand. No activities and no food.It is clean and quiet.To eat or drink you need to go back up and look for the Cafe/restaurant area (Bungalow)Trendy.Nearby Camps bay area, is lively with a lot of cafe's and restaurants.
Stunning. Sea is very cold but views are amazing well worth going down the steps to itTake a picnicits very clean
not all it is cracked up to be. very windy, long walk down steps to access beach - meaning long climb home, no bars or food at beach, water ice cold
camps bay. awesome white sandy beaches. immaculately clean but too cold to swim. great places for cocktails and snacks.

woow beach. well i went there for one day , they ve 4 beaches over there. i just loved the place and they have nice restaurants and cafes not far from the beach. although i could not swim cause the water was really cold , but i enjoyed having sun bath and i can assure you that CapeTown sun in summer can make you get tanned in no time :) ( fact from a guy came from Middle east :) ). Dnt miss watching Sun set .
Gorgeous beach. This beach is a must see. Make sure to take along a good camera. It is a close walk from Sea Point/Bantry Bay.

Pretty Beaches. Pretty beaches & pretty cold water, the beaches are separated by granite boulders and situated around a trending looking residential area, the houses seem to be nestled amoung the cliffs with sweeping views of the ocean, really nice area. While we were there it was quite windy, yet we enjoyed a relaxing time here on a sunny day.

Best Beach in Cape Town. This is the best beach in Cape Town as far as im concerned. Its more difficult to get to compared with Camps Bay as there are many steps but its well worth the effort. Also when the wind is blowing this beach is often sheltered
Super white beaches. Loved the beach to just relax. The water is extremely cold. The beach sand is spectacularly white but be prepared for a long climb down and murder on the legs going back up.

Nice beach in the shadow of Table Mt. Although the water was icy cold and you are asked to buy water or ice-cream every 2 minutes, it was still an enjoyable time at this beach. Wear sun screen - very hot sun!

As usual, the gays know whats best. clifton is one of the "most chic" and most pretty beaches. its known as the "gay beach", and ...as usual...gays know whats good :-)) many good looking people, well trained men...and also of course pretty girls. its more one of the "see and be seen"-spots, but i enjoyed
Pretty beach with titting cold water. Ogle at the pretty people and catch some rays. Only the brave venture into the super icey water (10-14 degrees). I did... bbbrrrr
Average. Clifton beach had nothing outstanding to offer. As Cape Town has many better beaches to offer i would not visit Clifton twice.
Lovely. A better choice than Camps Bay as waves gentler, but ocean still freezing. Slightly harder access so less crowds and 3-4 different beaches to choose from, just select which stairs to use.
Paradise. We spent time at Clifton Beach and had a great time. The place was like paradise - sun, sea and babes.

stunning beach. Clifton must rate as one of the most beautiful places on the coastline with its aquamarine colored waters
whilst it is a busy area this simply adds to the buzz
the walk down is worth it and this is a must visit beach

The place to be. stunning, hip hop & happening......Clifton - the beach for all seasons & all ages. Stunning scenery; cold water; where the trendy people of Cape Town go to soak up the summer sun.....

Just next to Camp's bay. There were 3-4 Clifton beaches there all accommodating not a very large crowd. Beautiful beach next to the hugely famous Camp's bay. There are a whole lot of restaurants, eateries and shops next to Camp's bay so you can very well plan your 2-3 hours at this place.

Summer is in the air:). One of my favourite things to do, as soon as summer hits Cape Town, is to leave work, jump into some shorts, put on my flip flops and head to clifton, for some post work beach magic.It's incredible, as soon as you hit the sand, it's an instant chill out.Snacks and drinks, with a beautiful sunset, with friends...summer time happiness.

Beautiful. Cold water, clean sand, lovely beach. Early morning or late afternoon best as the SA sun is brutal through the middle of the day. As always be careful of your belongings or better still leave them at home. There is always a security issue in this town and Clifton Beach is no exception,

Great Beach. One of the best beaches in Cape Town and worse a visit! Pick Beach No. 3. Beach No. 4 is only fine if you´re with dogs, otherwise to avoid. The waves are huge and great for body boarding.
5-star beach. A 5-star beach that is kept very clean. Beautiful white sandy beach. Very relaxing, not as crowded as Camps Bay can be.

stunning beach, Fresh atlantic!. wonderfull setting of beach with great villas and mountain background. Sea is very powerfull, Atlantic really cold.... We went there straight after landing from Europe and ate at the Bungalow restaurant- highly recommend
Really nice environment. I wish I have one House there.. Its a sweet view, sweet people, awesome beach, but the water is a bit cold :Ptry also the camps bay one, its near and also cool

The place to be seen but too busy in season. The beach is pretty but in season it is packed. Get there early to get your spot in the sun and a parking spot that is not too far away. The water is cold, 11 deg C but hey nobody goes to Clifton to swim anyway.

I love this beach!. Amazing beach, although the water is very cold it's very pretty. Nice vibe and a great people watching spot. There is no alcohol allowed on the beach but theres people that come to you and sell water and soft drinks. You can also rent lounge chairs and umbrellas.

Walk the bays. We walked from Gardens over the hill to Camps Bay, then from Camps Bay along the waterfront past Clifton Beaches, Bantry Bay. Bought a boerworst roll and ice cream at the pools, then caught a myciti bus back to Civic Centre. Was a great day out, didnt cost much and by walking you get to see everything close up.easy 12km walk, but dont forget to take WATER.

White sands and freezing waters. Having spent my childhood in the Cape, and most summers at Clifton, a return visit was tinged with expectation. I was not disappointed - beautiful stretches of pure clean white sand with great big boulders dotted around to offer some shade if required. Maybe it's the advent of age, but I do not remember the water being quite as cold as it was. Still very popular with the Cape Towns younger generation (all 4 beaches) and still an enjoyable day out at the beach. The backdrop of the spectacular Cape Town mountains only adds to the overall experience. Not to be missed.
Magnificent. An amazing beach full of posers, but great for people watching. It gets very hot so take plenty of cold drinks with you.

The place to be seen!. Clifton has for beaches, all small, but clean with gorgeous white sand. This is where the beautiful people of Cape Town hang out. Steep decent to get there & climb back, but a very nice place to spend some time.
THERE IS ONLY ONE!. THE SHEER SPLENDOR AND BEAUTY! It is just difficult to find parking and even more difficult to reach the beach!

Clean beach in prime area!. The beach is located near Camps Bay which is one of the posh localities in Cape Town. It's is a clean beach but is pretty crowded which may put off some travellers. I didn't really like it that much but it's good enough for one visit!

Gods Window..... Clifton has four beaches separated by huge granite boulders. Second beach is the best for sunsets, in summer, and third and fourth are best for sunsets in winter. Amazing sunsets from there, especially if there are some boats in the bay, and you can get a silhouette!best place in world

A day at the beach. My husband and I spent a day at #4 beach. The beach was gorgeous, though the water was cold. We rented an umbrella and two chairs for $13. Men moved up and down the beach selling snacks and drinks, but unfortunately there wasn't any real lunch available. Had we known we would have brought something with us. The beach had quite a few people on it, but it certainly wasn't crowded. It was a great day of people watching- even got to see a pick up rugby game.
Awesome Beach - stay for dinner. feels and look like Miami, you wont be disappointed. Pack for the day, hit the beach then stay for dinner.
Beautiful beaches!. I went on Beach #4 and it was full of people and action! The water was good...even in November! Great day over all!
Beautiful beaches. The view is spectacular and so surreal the water is so fresh but i must say COLD! Clifton 1 and 2 are less crowded and smaller in size, clifton 3 and 4 are more popular apparently.

Clifton 4th beach - Gorgeous :-). So we came to Clifton 4th beach on 2 occasions. It's a very beautiful beach with lovely white sand and its not to windy here as its quite sheltered. We also saw a whale on our first visit :-) its a nice place to come with your partner, friends or family. Everyone was having a good time :-)
scenic but cold mood. its beautiful and scenic ,at times to windy but this is cape town ,the houses are well designed but cold atmosphere ,people not so friendly like cape town centre

Big disapointment. I have been hearing about these 4 beaches as one of the best beaches in the world. Well, I wouldn't even put them among the first 500 no kidding! very small, long stairs up and down, rocks, isolated, no services, sea too cold to swim year round, surprised and disappointed.

Rich White People. There are plenty of other beautiful places in SA to see a great sunset or a nice beach without having to deal with rich white people racing around in their Porches and Maserati's: I can see that in LA. If you happen to be in the area on your way back into Cape Town stop by, but no reason to make it a point to get there.
Beautiful. We are not beach people but it was a fantastic beach. We enjoyed the atmosphere also, and had nice chats with other people
the place to be,. the place to be and by a house if you have enough money, nice beach but a lot of tourist and view from this point . try to go on the top of the mountain

Sunset visit. We visited Clifton several times on our stay in Cape Town, but by far the best was just before sunset. The beach had quiets down (During the day it can be very busy) and there was plenty of parking (Almost impossible to get during the day) the sun sets right in front of you providing beautiful photos, and romantic moments. The walk down to the beach, and on the way back up can be tiresome, but is well worth it for an hour of pure beauty. There are vendors selling ice cream and drinks during the day (They do pack up around sunset) but for anything more substantial you will need to leave the beach. Clifton is a MUST DO when in Cape Town!
Beach. Beautiful white beach sand set within a tranquil bay where the most gorgeous looking people can be seen soaking up the sunshine.
Absolutely 1 of the most beautiful beaches in the world. Protected from most winds,white sandy,very popular beach. Ideal for sun and beach lovers.very difficult to get parking near beach.

Better views from afar. This beach is good cause wind is blocked by mountains. Not much to do unless you go a mile down the road to Camps Bay which is the best location in Cape Town for beaches and dinning.

Cool water but nice beach, worth to visit. Little beach in a nice bay. The water as expected is freezing cold. However there are showers. You can order a grendine icecrream, soft drinks and chicken mayonaise sandwiches from vendors
excellent in all ways. should visit it in summers as in winter i could just past by the beach and could not spend time on the beach but i reccomend it

A steep climb but worth it.. Clifton Beach is actually semi divided into 4 beaches.
The beaches are 'divided' by rocks.
!st beach is a family beach with a restaurant and the like.
2nd beach if more for teenagers and those ladies who like to sunbathe topless.
3rd and 4th beaches are more for the more slightly conservative

WOW. money is no object here, the apartments rented are to diefor and of course the nudist beach! this is a fun and buzzy and young areas and we had loads of fun with cocktails and bars on the street right next to camps bay. love CT
Simply beautiful. The magazines don't have to enhance their photos of this place. It's literally as beautiful as the photos. No exaggeration.
Beautiful. Very cold water! Definitely no swimming. Amazing sunsets, although a little windy - but definitely bearable. It got chilly after sun down, so don't forget a jacket.

World class with a capital W.. Probably the trendiest beach in Cape Town where the beautiful people go. The sand is white and the water is blue ( but cold). The bodies are heavenly. It's normally very crowded and hot in summer but well worthwhile.

Perfect sunset beach. Cold water, clean sand and always a great vibe... this is how I have encountered Clifton beaches so far... and in summer with a bit of luck, you can encounter one of these marvelous sunsets!!

Clifton Beach #2 @ #3 are beautiful.. I only got 1 day to spend on this beach but I enjoyed it.
