My only downfalls are, how cold the water was for the middle of January(summer) and the lounge chair sharks(guys trying to force themselves on you with lounge chair rental and blocking of sections) . The sand was clean though. A few small interesting craft stands. I know further down they have many more shops and restaurants but I wasn't looking for that personally. I am a sun worshiper so I am usually tan or have a base, I seldom burn, well I got a burn on this beach. It must be more intense. Be careful in that dept.
Nice beach. There are 4 beaches in fact, one for each taste. Altough the place is a must see, the water is too freezing for a good swim.

Marvellous beaches. Clifton beaches (First to Fourth) are Cape Town's favourite beaches...for the beautiful to see or be seen. 4th Beach is family beach, 3rd beach is gay beach. (Not exclusive). Beautiful setting, white sand, protected from the wind. But the water is freezing!! Or as the locals say, "refreshing".
White sandy beach. Beautiful soft white sandy beach. Look out for the people stealing though. Go in groups - NEVER alone and go home before sun set. Go early as parking a nightmare to find.

Sunset!. Clifton has four beaches separated by huge granite boulders. Second beach is the best for sunsets, in summer, and third and fourth are best for sunsets in winter. Amazing sunsets from there, especially if there are some boats in the bay, and you can get a silhouette!The beaches are all generally clean, popular, and protected from wind. The water is cool and refreshing! And there are sporadic vendors for cooldrinks and ice lollies that wander around calling out their wares. Quite pricey, but I suppose that's their income and beachgoers are a captive market.

AMAZING. it is a very small beach but it is beautifull !! there is a special place where you can go and sit on the grass with a picnic and watch the sunset !! its a very fantsy place and very modern .. but the houses are amazing and the view is priceless !
Too lovely! One of Cape Town's finest beaches!. White sands, clear turquoise cold water...busy at Christmas and New Year. On a summers day - nothing better!

Beautiful, but beware of what lurks behind the boulders!. Stunning. Went on the 4th beach and managed to find a quiet spot to relax and read and listen to music. Birds flying all around and a short walk to get to Camps bay and eat at the beachside restaurants. I went another time and walked from 4th to 2nd, but behind the boulders entering the 2nd beach, some girls were doing a naked photoshoot! So perhaps if you are planning on taking children, you go first over the rocks! There was also a kitty on the beach which rounded off a wonderful experience.
Magic.... Think about, beautiful people, great English, reasonable prices, marvelous pics, sun, wind, and interesting architecture... Blend every single detail and have lots of fun!!!
Relaxing. Good for a stroll or a meal so if you can get there do. Might be a bit expensive by taxi so maybe it is best to do it on a day or half day tour.
Relax. Come here and relax for the day or just for a walk, you will not be disappointed. When you tired of sitting by the beach, go over and have a drink at one of the many bars along the beach front

Aesthetically, a winner!. Always so easy on the eye. In Summer Clifton is bustling with the whos who of Cape Town and it is not unusual to see the main road chocablock with Ferraris and sports cars alike.
Alright. Overrated, but a nice place to sit and have a picnic in the evenings. Sometimes it gets a bit crowded though, so choose which of the beaches to go to carefully.
Best beach in the area. Protected by the wind and oh so beautiful... What could I say that has not been said yet. Clifton is a great spot.

Where the sun never sets. The beach is just stunning during summer and just beautiful during winter. The awesome thing about the Cape is that you will find warm days in the heart of winter; where you can enjoy Clifton

True Beach Experience. I've traveled and seen many beaches but this is definitely one of the most beautiful. A lot of photo shoots are taken here for a reason as it represents the typical holiday beach experience perfectly. Proper beach sand, shimmering water, some well placed rocks to climb. The only thing missing would be long rows of benches and umbrellas!This is a must visit and has great amenities nearby.

Great view, clean water. Went there a bunch of times with Debbie in March, right before it got too cold.Generally really clean and nice. The water is as cold as any beach around Cape Town, but definitely swimable. It's very calm and clear. Probably not the best beach for surfers but it's great for just hanging out and for swimming.

What can I say... One of the reasons to relax in CT. I avoid it during sunny weekends because of the crowd and the difficult parking...For the rest great for people watching. Seeing the whole world laying at your feet. Nice massages on the beach... Never overly crowded. Priceless sunsets.Contra: cold water, sometimes construction noise and certainly the sellers who come by, shouting grenadilla lolly' s , directly from Iceland.
Superb beach. Super clean beach. With toilets available, life guards too.And this is set in a the most beautiful surroundings too!
Great views and setting. Clifton Beach is more for the younger crowd. Water is far too cold to swim in, but you find this does not stop most people from getting in.
Good Beach. This is very attractive beach near and around the city of Cape Town . Along the visit to other important places we can rest for a while here and enjoy the nature
Fun in the sun. Great place to catch a tan, play ball, swim and generally enjoy oneself in a upper market environment.

Dream & Steam. After a hard day, season, year you deserve a break. Clifton Beach offers a break that will leave you re-charge and ready to take on the world again. Water, sunshine and beautiful people comes in even supplies and the cold-drink vendors add local humor.

Summer Loving. Eat my shorts St Tropez, this place is the spot to be in the height of summer. Beautiful bodies adorn sandy white beaches. Hope you know how to play bats or volleyball if you want to be here around sunset.

Not to be missed!. Clifton is a fantastic place with villas, one more beautiful than the other one. The beaches are lovely here, the walks too. It is especially nice on the weekend where you should stop here for a long walk.

Lovely beaches. These are lovely beaches. Just never enough parking so get there early. No drinking allowed on the beach. If you forget your umbrella you can rent one there. Also a small restaurant if you need some food and beverages.

Nice beaches. Little walk down the steps and you will find yourself in these small beaches. Nice, clean and beautiful view. 3rd beach mostly used by gay community but I've seen many other people too. Families and solo girls. 4th beach is a bit bigger and more crowded. Recommended!

Nice, Clean, Quiet, Freezing cold water!. The beach is small but lovely. Plenty parking but a really really steep walk down to beach. Water is freezing cold, but your body adjusts after about five minutes.
Atlantic Sea Board. as a fan of the water...what a coast to digest in...the air, the views and for me a water fanatic, a swim is ideal...
Brilliant sheltered beaches. Nice choice between busy and quiet within a few minutes walk. Almost always sheltered for wind, even if it storms at Camps Bay Beach. Clean and easy accessible.

WOW. Soft white sand, crystal clear water, warm African sun on your face... what more could you ask for? This beach is stunning, the only downside is that the water is FREEZING cold! We were lucky enough to see a seal playfully enjoying the water very close to shore. This is a lovely place to sit back and relax while in Cape Town. You can also pretend that you are living like the rich and famous who have stunning houses overlooking Clifton Beach ;)

Non serviced beach - beautiful. This beaches are numbered 1-4, where 4 is the biggest (and often most ppl here). 1 and 2 more used by locals. We stayed most of the time at beach nr 3, its very nice. You can lend a sunchair for approx 100 rands for a day. Expect the usual local walking around selling water, ice cream and sodas.

Amazing. Lovem all, espeically the boys and the queens. fun fun fun white sands and icy cold water. The trip down to clifton is even more interesting personally. Do not drink and wallk up those stairs

Great beach!. Great beach with amazing restaurants nearby. You only need to pay for a seat and an umbrella and you are set for the whole day. People pass by selling refreshing beverages and little snacks so you don't even have to move. Water was a little cold but otherwise we had a great time!
Best beach in Cape Town. My favourite beach in Cape Town. It has the least wind and the most seclusion. I prefer Clifton 4th due to the shape, but wander along the all and find your favourite.
a gem of cape town. pure white sand and beautiful woman!protected against wind and you have a choice of 1st strand,2nd,3rd and the bigger 4th.even warm winters days are pleasant for a picnic

go to Clifton 3. By far the best beaches for Cape Town. go to third: toilets and possibilitie to rinse of the salt water at the lifeguard house. and a couple of vendors selling refreshments: coke zero to make your boyfirned a hero, coke light to make your tummy tight!!

Lots of steps to get to it, but beautiful beach. Beautiful white sandy beach. Truly spectacular as it is shielded from the wind by huge boulders and is so splendid at anytime, in the morning, afternoon and after sunset in summer as well as in winter. Perfect even on a windy day in Cape Town as it is wind-free due to its perfect location. The only thing is if you are not very fit or tired, just a word of caution, there are lots of steps to get down. Imagine the way up! There are no restaurants down there, so before you go all the way down to the beach, make sure you have all you need like water, umbrella, sun cream, sandwich as you might not want to go back down after you've made your way up the steps from the beach. If you want to avoid the steps, I suggest you go to the fourth beach as there are less steps and they are not as steep as those of the other beaches in Clifton.

The meeting place. These beaches are wonderufl but if you are disabled there is no way down as there are steep steps down but again the beaches are white and the sand so so soft....best place to meet and have a picnic, there are a few little coves and the rocks offer protection if the wind should come up....mainly a beach for the young professionals as the steps keep the oldies at bay...the views from the road are amazing and the homes even more amazing

Beauty- filled beaches...literally!. Beautiful beaches with equally beautiful people either lounging, tanning, surfing, beach batting or just general fun in da sun ! There are 4 bays of beach at Clifton - beware the stairs,at 1st beach...!

What South of France??. With the surrounding mountains and luxury homes hanging down over the cliffs, what an amazing amphitheater for a series of beaches. Very cold water, but white clean sand.. A perfect spot to sunbathe, watch the beautiful people and relax...
White beach. Most beautiful beach in Cape Town and all the beautiful people hang out here as well. Come early to find parking

Best Beach in CT. Cape Town is known for it's crazy wind, but the Clifton beaches ere sufficiently sheltered and perfect nearly every day. The busiest beaches are 4th and 2nd. We like 3rd beach because it is a little quieter. The beaches are clean and there are sellers who sell cokes, water and ice cream to the beach-goers but they only accept cash. There is not a lot of parking to the beaches and it can get very busy over public holidays. Beach goers do have to walk down a lot of stairs to get to the beaches.4th beach is where you'd go to show off ;)
The place to enjoy. If the sun is shining then this is the beach to go to. The water is freezing but all the fashionable folk make it worthwhile.

Stunnning white sand beach.. I used to live in Cape Town, so frequented Clifton a lot in my youth. On a recent trip back, we went to Clifton beach a few times. One has to descend a number of steps to access the beach, but it is worth it, especially on a day when most other beaches in Cape Town are very windy. It is advisible to get there early to get parking, but in the off season, it is not usually a problem. It is possible to rent beach chairs and umbrellas. Life guards were on duty when we were there. There are 4 beaches. 1st beach is tough to get to. 2nd and 3rd beaches are great. 4th beach is the most popular for families with kids. It gets so hot, that one usually has to brave the cold ocean temperatures for a quick dip. There are change facilities and cold showers at the beach. Roving sellers will be happy to sell you cold water, pop or ice cream. You have to try the "Granadilla Lolly" (a tropical fruit flavoured popsicle)! Although the beaches here are safe, is not advisable to leave one's belongings unattended at any beach in South Africa.

Beauty to behold. This blue flag beach is well maintained with interesting houses and always crowded with gliterrati, fashionistas and out and proud community -what a spirit, what a vibe- viva the clifton. Sundowners and a picnic are recommended, get there early to avoid parking problems. Oh to live in one of those divine beach houses - makes one drool. The sea is freezing and the sand white -good lifeguards. The view - to die for darl
Beautiful Panaromic View. The Ocean was cold and it was very windy the day we were there, but it was nice to sit on one of the terraces and have a drink and overlook the beach and ocean.
Best beach in Cape Town. Went to Clifton 2nd beach on a windy afternoon when cableway was closed and its perfect little beach nestled amongst the rocks! Best kept secret in Cape Town
Fantastic Beach. This has been my favourite Beach since I first visited Cape Town in 1972. The views are magnificent as you will see when you walk along all 4 beaches.
No.2 on the list of beaches. No. 1 - Llandudno, worth the short drive and doesn't get too crowed.No. 2 - Clifton - 2nd beachNo. 3 - Camps Bay, not in the wind!

Chill Beach. Incredibly laid back, relaxing, and beautiful beach. The water is really cold even in the summer, but you can get used to it. I did after about 5 tries :)It feels great to go in for a cool dip and then come out to dry off in +30 weather!It's a vibey place. The day we went there was a stage set up for a concert later in the afternoon.Highly recommend it if you want to just lounge around and do nothing but watch life pass by.
great beach. 4 beaches, but you can stay in the 1st one. take the "hop in hop off" bus and from camps bay you can take a taxi until clifton. great place to spend the afternoon doing nothing.

Beach Day for the whole family. Experience the more upper class end of Cape Town and spend a day on the beach of Clifton. Very lively atmostsphere througout the day and plenty of food available just a short walk away.

Stunningly beautiful. This beach is stunningly beautiful. The sand is very soft and felt great underfoot. But don't expect to go swimming unless you are a polar bear club member. The water is very cold.

Simply stunning. You have to go here to experience the beauty of this, or these beaches as there are actually 3 coves. Palm trees, bourgonvillia, tropical plants. Every time we have been the white sand beaches have been deserted.

Beautiful beaches. Every traveler should visit Clifton on a trip to Cape Town. There are four beaches separated scenic natural rocks. I personally prefer Clifton beach 1 and 2 although they are generally the busiest. There is also a good cocktail bar / restaurant called 'The Bungalow' which is walking distance from the beaches.

Beautiful beach but oh is the water cold. I don't think anyone heads to Clifton to swim. It seems more like a place to walk around, have a meal, drink, see and be seen. The views of the ocean and Table Mountain and the apostles are stunning. There is a nice bar/restaurant up there that used to be called La Med. Very sceney but great for sunsets.
People watching. After a walk along the beach, grab a beer(or cocktail) in one off the bars and watch the world go by

Best beach in Cape Town. We always go to Clifton 3rd beach when visiting Cape Town. Yes its the one that is always described as the 'gay' beach, but that does not mean that you cant go and as with all the Clifton beaches there is always good people watching. Dip your toes in the cold sea, but that will tell you dont even think about going in or everyone will know you are a visitor!
Beach nb 3. Beautiful beach view white sand rocks aside. Nica gay men.Umbrellas chairs for rent.Beach boys selling cold drinks.
Nice picturesque. Beautiful place to just see. Imagine living there! A beautiful beach along with Camps Bay area! One feel envious of Cape Towners at the sheer joy one can get from this area

Best Beach. Best beach from no of other spots on the Cap drive with fabulous view of Blue Ocean on one side and 12 Apostles on the other.The crowd is very good and mostly Families and white sandy beach with Beach side villas and Apartments overlooking the beach is great place. One can even consider as staying option on trip to capetown.
most beautiful beach. Secluded private white beach, water a bit cold, but the best bodies in Cape Town. Summer time on Clifton in CT is where you should be!

Where atmosphere is warm .... Brilliant. Blue sky, palm trees, good music and swiming pool
AND THE BEACH ....
Good food BUT far away too noisy by street activities (taxis driver shouting, polution. What ? POLUTION FROM TRAFIC .
Unfortunetly we left bcs that

Place to be seen. White sand, cold water, [ Atlantic Ocean], this rates as one of the finest beaches in the world. Worth the walk down to the beach. Divided into 4 beaches each with its own flavour.
The views from the top are to die for. The place to anchor ones yacht when coming from Cape Town.

One of the premier beaches in the World. Four distinct beaches down many stairs from the street. Suggest park at 4th beach -least amount of stairs to the beach & it has changing rooms, toilets & Umbrella and chair rentals.

Crystal blue water and white salty sand. Clifton 4th beach is great for families as the walk is easy without too many steps. The Atlantic ocean's crystal blue water is complimented by the stark white salty sand and beautiful bodies that adorn the beach. The water is cold and I only managed to stay in for a maximum of 15 minutes but most people last less than 15 seconds. A great beach with little wind.

Scene out of a movie!. The scenery is that of which you would see in a movie- probably bc you have. This hot spot is the place to go for lots of little places to eat and enjoy the view of the beach. Beware- the water may look stunning but it is also stunningly cold!!
Beautiful beach. Clifton is amazing, beautiful beach with a great vibe, takes a while to get used to the temperature of the water though ;-))
The South African Riviera. Four lovely beaches in a row - first beach my favourite although a pleasant longer walk - stay to watch the breathtaking sunsets.

AWESOME AGAIN. I CAN'T GET OVER THE CAPE TOWN BEAUTY...........I shall repeat " absloutely brilliant , the views are to die for i used to like santorini and mykonos in greece but trust me cape town is far far far superior "

Moonstruck. Went to Clifton 4th beach for the annual Moonstruck concert last week. What a great venue, the beach is magnificent. Protected from the wind, the water was ice cold, but great for cooling down in the hot hot sun. The music was great, good vibe and people. They sold snacks and drinks on the beach which was great so you didn't have to slap a picnic basket.

Beautiful!. A beach with white sand, blue waters, with yaughts docked in the bay. Beach volleyball is usually being played, and lots of beach bums lazing in the sun.The beach is also quite sheltered from the wind - you have to walk down the beach which is surrounded by rocks. Loungers and umbrellas are also available for hire at minimal cost. There are also guys selling soft drinks and ice cream. There isn't really food available, so rather take food with you. You won't find anyone in the water - because it is freeeeeezing! If you want (slightly) warmer water, rather go to a beach on False Bay (Boulders bay, Vishoek etc). By night - the beach transforms to those with picnics, surrounded by candles.
Gorgeous beach!. Beautiful white sands! Clean beaches! Great location for a couples picnic or a family day out. Atlantic ocean is cold but relaxing in the sun makes up for it.
Cold by beautiful. One of the most beautiful beaches, surrounded by restaurants, etc. The water are freezing but the surroundings are awesome.

Most beautiful beach on earth.. The cleanest most beautiful beach on earth. Clean ablution facilities. Pure white sand , cool breazes from the Atlantic. Spa on the beach available. Cold drinks and icecream sold daily. Just got to be there!!!!!

This is my favorite beach in Cape Town. There are several Clifton beaches all connected. You have to hike down a path to get to the beach... but it is totally worth it. The beaches are pristine and gorgeous. There are usually vendors there to rent you umbrellas and chairs. You can also buy food and drink. One of the best things is that even on a windy day, these beaches are semi-protected and you do not get the wind that you would at Camps beach.

Beautiful Beaches and Houses. Some of the best beaches around the Capetown area are in Clifton Beach, 4 great beaches especially Boulder beach, the houses there are some of the best we've seen in South Africa.
Beautiful. Sunny, clean, happy people, real vacation spot. Did not sunbathed, but enjoyed the atmosphere from a terrace. It made a great impression on me, both the people and the place.

great view & scenery. Camps Bay will stay my favourite of the 2 beaches for swimming purposes [I prefer waves!], but it's a nice beach to have a picnic on summer eve's or relax on Sundays, if you can get a spot. Parking a bit of a mission, but that's Cape Town for you!
What a breathtaking view. It was very stylish and hip area and great places in the surrounds , hot beaches to chill! Only dislike is the taxi's very noisy and dangerous

MY SPOT. I absolutely LOVE Clifton and have been going there for more than 30 years. 3rd beach is my favourite and the beach vendors are great, friendly and helpful. I don't want to say too many good things or too many people will go there!!!

Idyllic spot but can be windy!!. We cycled to Clifton beach and thought it was stunning!! Secluded and quiet, bright white sand, waves crashing on to the shoreline and rocks to find shade. Easily passed a day people watching and relaxing. Perfect!!
Pristine Beach. Great beach you will need to hike down about a 70 foot clif to the beach. The water is very rough and a little chilly but the area is very senic. Not a good beach for young families.
Heaven!. One of the lovliest beaches on earth, and if your lucky you may get a visit from the odd inquisitive Penguin!

Clean experience. This beach really wow me. It is clean, safe and the water is nice.I had a nice time with family and friends and would recommend others to visit the beach as well. It is a very popular beach and I think everyone would enjoy the clear waters.I must say, from my opinion, this is really one of Cape Town's favourable beaches.

Spent two hours at Cliffton Beach, Cape Town, South Africa.. We were able to park our rented car on the side of the street. Even though it was peak season, were still able to park the car. Enjoyed relaxing on the beach and walking along the beach for two hours. It's not really a place to swim, even though it was the middle of summer, the water is still very cold here. But still a lovely beach to suntan and relax and enjoy sundowners.

Small, clean, quiet beach. Clifton is a large stretch of beach sectioned off into four areas (funnily enough, you'll see signs for Beach 3 3/4 as well, whatever that means). It can get pretty crowded over the summer, but overall it's a clean, quiet beach in a safe area. The water is not for swimming, unless you like ice cold water. But you can lie out in the sun and hail down one of the ice cream men for a sweet treat now and then.I've seen people bring and set up volleyball nets. It can get really windy toward late afternoon, but during midday you can definitely bump a volleyball around.There aren't really any eateries nearby (it's a residential area), so bring your own food if you plan to stay a while.
Clean and safe beach. We were happy to see that the beach area was clean and safe. However the water was extremely cold, so not really good for swimming
small but nice. The beach is really a small little one, with icy waters when we visited, but saw dolphins and enjoyed lunch, watching the fancy cars and women.

Body beautiful. Clifton is known for its beauties and freezing water surrounded by the most expensive real estate in SA. Always fun to visit, if parking is available and you have an appetite to for a picnic on the beach. Carrying the picnic basket down the stairs can be tiring but worth it, as there is seldom the south Easter blowing in clifton

One of the best beaches in the world. Clifton has the most fantastic location. It has white sands and a freezing ocean, which is a relief on a blistering hot day. You can hire a sun bed and umbrella, and they sell cool drinks on the beach. The passion fruit ice lolly is perfect for cooling down. 4th beach is best for families as it is easy to get to. 3rd beach is good if you prefer some peace.

super place to unwind. this Beach is a famous place for locals, said to be a posh-area to live in, the apartments are supposedly at very high prices and it has a rocky coastline broken by small beautiful sandy beaches. a must if you are visiting Capetown especiall on the weeend when there are more pople unwinding.
A vibe,. The whole Clifton/Camps Bay Area has such a vibe and while congested during December, is nothing as busy as other international beaches of this stature.
Nice spot. We drove through this area on a tour...would definitely like to come back and spend more time. Beautiful landscape.

A beach with a view. No trip to Cape town would be complete without a visit to the Clifton beaches. Clifton IV beach is my favorite.It can get windy, but is more sheltered than Camps Bay, but that does mean a walk down some steep steps and parking is limited.However, once on the beach you get a fantastic view if Lions Head dominating the skyline and the pretty wooden beach houses that hug the side of the cliffs around the beach.It used to have a cafe at the top by the car park, but this remains closed which is sad as it really needs a beach restaurant. Otherwise the beach sellers will provide ice creams etc. at usual inflated prices.
Great beach. The only downside is the number of stairs down to the beach and of course, the icy water of the Atlantic Ocean!!
very cold water. The water at Clifton beach was freezing cold even in December (summer). This was pretty crowded place. The beach is very clean and has fantastic view.

Relaxing beach. Clifton comprises 4 beaches - fourth is my favourite with its fine sand and family atmosphere. There are reasonably priced sun beds, drinks, ice creams and snacks, so you don't have to carry your own. There are quite a number of steps down (and up!) but the climb is definitely worth the effort. If only the sea were warmer this beach would be perfection.
Life's a beach. Well sheltered from the wind, Clifton is a great place to catch a tan. Although the water is a bit cold and lots of seaweed, it is still the beach of Cape Town.

Blue flag beach Clifton- look out for water pollution. Clifton beach is one of the most scenic beaches on the Cape Peninsula. It is a blue flag beach and is enjoyed by children and families. Before you go, always check the board indicating the water quality. There are days when the water is heavily polluted with sewage water. Despite that children and adults are still swimming in the water and playing on the beach. Even there are obvious signs of wastewater pollution, they do not seem to know about the health hazards of sewage water contaminated with E. coli and Enterococcus faecalis. Unfortunately the water quality is only checked every 14 days, that is a far too long interval. It is very sad that wastewater is still being pumped without prior cleaning and filtration into our oceans causing diarrhea, skin infection, respiratory tract infection, hepatitis etc. Dogs are forbidden on some parts but are regardless of that make use of the beach and are sometimes interfering with and attacking children playing there.

Don't forget the wetsuit!. Definitely a must see, however, the water temperature is extremely cold, if you desperateley want to get into the South African waters bring a wetsuit of at least 7mm, or try the tide pools, its where the locals swim. Don't forget to eat, these beaches are not aligned with bars and restaraunts, and we just happened to visit when the nearby country club was closed.

Great beaches. You can't go to Cape Town and not go to Clifton beach! There are four beaches o choose from. What is great is that you are Pretty much protected from the strong winds and it makes sitting on the beach very enjoyable. The sunsets are to die for. The scenery is stunning, but the water is breathtakingly cold!!! Hahaha a must in Cape Town!!!

CLIFTON. I am an ex Capetonion and to miss out on Clifton or any of the other beaches then you have missed amazing scenery.You will see a beautiful beach and difficult to tell you about it.It is a must on your list when visiting beaches.Bathroom facilities not good , many not disabled friendly. Why they cannot put railings both sides to help you get up and down is a mystery to me. We are living in a modern world and they have to give attention to it.

Beaches of the fairest Cape. Clifton's four beaches are among the most beautiful beaches in the world. Pristine white sand and the cold Atlantic sea to refresh you when it gets too hot! Each beach has its own particular ambience and group of people. Explore all of them and don't forget to have a grenadilla lolly while you take in the scene!

Lovely and clean with white sand and huge waves. A great day out, with lovely white sand and awesome waves. You can hire sun beds and umbrellas and there are beach sellers if you need drinks and Ice creams. You do need to walk down a number of steps before you get to the beach.
Extraordinary. Extraordinary beach. Sexy people. Little parking. Clifton 3 is a tiny beach. Clifton 4 is a lot bigger.

a bit too pretentious and with models wanna-be. The beaches are a bit too pretentious and with models wanna-be laying on the beach, taking 10 minutes or so to put on sun tanned lotion. they are quite crowded but the good thing is that it's close to the city. The beaches could be close because of high tide as the beaches are not that big. I didn't feel relax because of the crowd but you have to at least be there once to see it for yourself.
very pretty. great place to spend a day in the sun between boulders and in blue water. Place looks like a post card
Beautiful. The beach is beautiful, fine sands, icy cold water. The shade of the ocean provides such tranqulity. Its a good spot to relax and unwind.
see and be seen. Sea, see and be seen then this the place. Parking is a hassle and walk down not for everyone but stunning beach with little wind

My favorite beach in Cape Town. I was in Cape Town for work and spend an empty Saturday at Clifton Beach and was in heaven. I had a taxi drop me off at 1st beach, walked down the staircase between the homes and was amazed by the view as soon as I saw the water. As I walked on the sand from 1st to 4th beach it seemed to get busier with sun bathers, umbrellas and vendor so I made my way back to 2nd beach. Only one of the beaches allows dogs...I think it was 1st.After lunch I made my way down to Camps Bay Beach but it was too crowded for my liking. Clifton is separated from the road by a hillside and houses which creates a nice secluded feel.

Soaking up the sun. Clifton Beach Cape Town is like heaven on earth on a typical summer's day in the Mother City. No wind , relentless sunshine , jolly people everywhere and best of all the refreshing sea water to cool you down. I would be nowhere else when it's 30 degrees except Clifton Beach to keep me cool and to thoroughly enjoy a day at the beach.Diving off the rocks at Clifton 4th beach is so much fun and swimming from one rock to the next so exciting . Swimming at Clifton beach kind of invigorates the body . Sitting on the rocks your body soaks up all the heat on offer then when you've had enough you jump or dive from the rocks into the refreshing 12 degrees Atlantic ocean, what a feeling. Only the real thing can make you explain this feeling.

Could be the Seychelles. Could be the Seychelles except the temperature of the water. 16 degres max in summer. Hard to keep your tan as you become blue in the water! :-) But the beaches of Clifton are stunning. They are 4 of them. Must be!

Cape Town's piece of paradise: soft white sand with cold blue water. It is my first choice of beach in Cpt. unforgettable sunsets are visible from the beach... Nestled between the multimillion rand apartments and the cold blue sea... Soft sands, lovely sun. Take your towel, beachbed and umbrella with. The beach also hire umbrellas and beachbeds at a bit costly price. Take plenty of snacks, drinks, sunhat,sunblock and a book. For the kids take beach toys, spades, buckets and ball... Its a long way down the 101 stairs so take just enough to carry for one trip down the 101 steps to the beach. Vendors do sell ice lollies and coldring on the beach. Street Parking is limited so be prepared to walk if you do not leave early for the beach. There is paid parking at the Clovelly Country Club which is where I always prefer to park. No alcohol is allowed on the beach. There are also no pets frequenting this beach, so no dog is going to take awizz on your picnic basket of sandcastle... It is a must summer experience for Cape town.

As a beach, Clifton is for posers only. You can't really surf here, the beaches are really tiny, and the sea is too cold for swimming. It is certainly picturesque, but as a beach (actually a few small ones) it is a dead loss. All about posing and tanning and looking cool, even if you are as hot as a lime burners boot on a barbie fork because the sea is too cold to swim. Say what, YOU go there!

Stunning beach. There are 4 beaches in Clifton which is a few minutes walk from Camps Bay main beach. Clifton 1st, 2nd, 3rd and 4th. You have to park on the main road at the top and walk down a lot of steps to the beach. 4th is the most popular especially at weekends and at sundown for the wonderful sunsets over the ocean, Too cold to swim but good to walk along the 4 beaches for a paddle if you don't mind your feet freezing.
A good few beaches. A bit of a climb down to the beaches but worth it, wind free and super clean. water is safe too. (no sharks)

Stunningly gorgeous beach. It has to be one of the most beautiful beaches in the world (Clifton 3). Gorgeous men and beautiful sand. The sea is as bracing as the North Sea which is welcome given the strength of the sun.
3rd Beach - Gay Haven. If you want a gay friendly beach, go to 3rd beach. Packed with glistening beach bodies and sea and surf to match

Blonde sand and blonde bodies. Very well looked after and frequented by gorgeous people. The water however verges on freezing. Difficult to find parking and a long walk up and down steps depending upon which of the four beaches you frequent. Fourth is the most popular.
Great. Loevly sandy in beach in a very upmarket location. Mind teh see though it is freezing all the time. Great view up towards Table Mountain and the Twelve Apostles
Beautiful beaches. Busy shops, restaurants, villas, hotels and beaches. Fast paced but so much fun. Easily available on the hop-on, hop-off bus.

beautiful, for the young crowd. the beaches are beautiful (there are 4 of them, # 4 is the famous one & more crowded), the setting with the rocks is amazing. however, you park up on the main road & you have to carry your things down to the beach, on many steps. it becomes less comfortable coming up. the beach is very crowded in the summer & has no cafes/ restaurants.
Too cold to swim in October. but what a beach. I could have spent the whole afternoon just admiring the scenery. Spectacular rocks, amazing plants and colors
Absoulutely Awesome. It is a really brilliant beach. It is always fun to play in the sea. They have really great concerts there.
Mooi. Lekker chilled, amazing atmosphere the only bad thing is that the actual sea is absoulutely, terribly and extremely cold!!!!

More than 52 steps. After descending down the great number of steps from road level to the beach one can soon start to unwind. If you have become a little hot from making your way down putting a toe, or if youre brave a bit more of yourself, in the ice cold water will soon have that sorted. The sand is white and inviting and the backdrop of the large rocks adds plenty of atmosphere. It is also sheltered, so while the wind may be howling in other parts of the Cape Peninsula, you will not be sandblasted at Clifton.

Super. A great place for a swim, stroll, eating and just soaking up the atmosphere. The beauty of it you can either hop on or off as often as you like depending how long you want to stay either by the red or blue bus.

the beaches in the whole wide world!!. the famous 4 beaches of clifton in cape town, south africa, are world known! the sand is soft and silky, the water, ice cold. the girls in their tiny bikini's - the most beautiful in the world - long limbed and leggy, gorgeous bodies, glistning under the blazing african sun - the men, not to shabby either!!4th beach is the family beach - wow! jam packed in summer - too many people, and not enough sand!the smell of food at lunch time is lip smaking good, as the families unpack their hampers, and tuck in to their home packed lunches. some do deli packed as well!once again, silky soft sand, warmer water, and lots and lots of blazing sun.cover up, use your sunscream, get fit, to walk up and down the many stairs, bring lots of money, to hire a chair and umbrella, and to buy ice cream, water and cold drinks at ridiculous prices, and sit back and relax!remember the camera, and bribe the children r5 each time they photograph a beautiful, topless young lady, and you are in for the time of your life!!please international guests - if you have been to the french rivera, you ain't seen nothing yet! clifton is unique, with the bright bly sky, the sun shining down, spreading all the good vitimin d around you, and the spectacular mountains surround you, and shelter you from any wind!please do not litter our beautiful beaches - there are ample garbage bins arround to hold the rubbish.you haven't lived until you have lain on one of clifton's 4 beaches - cape town welocmes you all warmly - enjoy!
The 4 beaches of Clifton!. World-class and wind-free especially from the summer South Easter! Nothing beats these beaches on a perfect summer's day!
one of the most pictresque beaches in the world. if goinfg in summer,get there early (by 9am) otherwise you will really battle to find parking!but make the effort,and remember the sunblock!

Beautiful Beach. Truly beautiful beach but the water is freezing - even by UK standards. Don't forget the sunscreen thought - you might not feel it at the time but will suffer later.If you're on a budget take your own supplies as there isn't much there in the way of shops and the beach boys selling "cokes, ice cream, water, water, ice cream, cokes" are relatively expensive by local standards.
You cant beat it !. Even in October when the sun is out its possible to unwind get some sun and even enjoy the crisp clear water (very cold) but certainly refreshing !

A pearl in the crown. Clifton beach is a safe bet for a sheltered beach if the wind is up in Cape Town. Last visit was for the Moonstruck event - perfect evening - many luxury yachts and boats in the bay.

Paradise. Clifton Beach is gorgeous! The 4 beaches all have a distinct vibe to it. I preferred 4th beach because it was less windy and didn't have as many children. Beware that the Altantic Ocean is extremely cold! I was told that the water is actually warmer in the winter! There are vendors that walk around selling cold drinks and snacks.

Picturesque Bungalows and perfect Sea wit Granite Boulders. Easily accessible from the road if you are walking along the seafront, a perfect/majical beach, chairs/beds available for rent. You can experience the exhilirating sea, walk among the boulders, or just relax.
Beautiful. Where the wealthy live. Here they film a lot. Exclusive and lovely. Four bays numbered one to four each attuned to different needs.

My favorite!. It is a lovely beach which is close to the city center. There are 4 different Clifton beaches. All of them were awesome and safe. There are security cameras everywhere. Even if it was spring (end of october), the beaches were quite busy. We tried to swim but Atlantic ocean was FREEZING..Overall, Strongly Recommended!!

clifton Beach. I was there in October 2012..the water was cold..(cuz at this time the sezon in Africa is spring).. but anyway interesting...sands are white..road is very beatiful..a lot of restaurants..It is not far from Capetown,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,.......................................................................

keep to the 4th 3rd and 2nd beaches. walked to 4th 3rd and 2nd beaches, all perfect examples of Cape Towns best beaches....but the main one 1st beach is very over-developed, and totally spoilt in my eyes.....shame they have allowed so much building work...
Nice stop. Beautiful beach on the way to Cape Good Hope. This is a high rent distric and when you see it you understand why.

Perfect!. There are a view beaches in Clifton, each as lovely as the other. You will not regret visiting any one of those in the summer. Beautiful weather, beautiful people and a truly marvelous holiday atmosphere.
1st beach my favourite. you have to walk down a thousand steps , but you are rewarded by a beautiful little beach , with a couple of rocks , and a magnificent little bay , so worth the climb !

PLAYGROUNDS OF THE RICH AND BEAUTIFUL. Exceptional views, beautiful bodies, modern architecture, sandy white beaches and icy cold water. Clifton is next to Camps Bay where there are marvelous restaurants to choose from.

lots of beaches in Capetown. here the rich and famous apparently come here to see and to be seen. row upon row of restaurants as well as holiday makers at Clifton Beach. Apart from Clifton Beach, you can also plan to visit Boulders Beach, Camps Bay, Hout Bay. Capetown has beautiful sandy beaches but unfortunately, the water is fairly chilly!
Beautiful. This beach is in the beautiful and affluent area of Clifton. Grab a cocktail while you're there. Don't expect to swim here - it's Atlantic ocean and chilly.

basic instinct. i am not sure , but i feel thats the palce were BI was shot . view to die for , u will like to buy the houses there but after lsitening to the prices u will change ur mind .. will be good in summers only

One of the Worlds Best!. Scenic for is natural as well as sun tanned bodies beauty!! The who's who of glamourous Capetonians pop down after work for a picnic, catch some rays and enjoy being seen. the walk down is worth the trip. make sure you personal belongings are safe as you may loose it to a beach scallywag. not unusual happens if you don't take care of what you leave around, I found out to my detriment. we live and learn!!

Shame about the cold North Atlantic. Fabulous golden sand beaches. There are 4 in total, each separated by rocks and boulders.4th beach is the one most poulated by sun worshipers. The others access is more difficult, as there are more steps.Can be windy.If only the sea wasn`t soooo coooold
feel free. besides wonderful street cafe's, tourist atmosphere, cabrule's, redwine blends and celebs, it's gr8 to feel part of the fibrant surrounds!
Upclass nd beaut. Beautiful, White beach with stunning view, of sea & Beach houses, & a nice little Beach shop/Restaurant to sit & chillax at :D
Breathtaking. What a lovely relaxing place number three beach. My wife and myself had a peaceful time here a little piece of paradise
One of the best beach ever seen. Beautiful and very quiet beach almost in the center of city, great sand, amazing view, a must see in Cape Town.
Awesome beach, but gets busy. Beautiful beach, very scenic but gets really crowded in summer with parking becoming a problem, but its sheer beauty is worth visiting
Serene and peaceful. it was raining..the sea was roaring..the beach was quiet..and the sight was magnificent..Loved my time..good restaurants around with many choices..accessible and world CLASS

The four beaches located in opulence.. These small but sheltered beaches are a great hide out when the wind blows, although swimming is only for the brave. Sun tanning and partying is a must. and a glass of wine or a picnic to watch the sunset will enthral you.
Too much boulders. As the name says. Too rocky and cold water. Not for swimming, just for modelling, it is really tidy and great sand tough.

Beautiful Beach. The Clifton beaches are all beautiful. We went in the winter so they were empty, and we climbed from #4 all the way to #1 to look around and take photos. We had a lot of time to spend in Cape Town and were glad we made the short trip here, however, if you're only in town for a couple days, we would suggest things that are more uniquely cape town. It's a beautiful beach, but you can see that elsewhere too.

A Beach with a panoramic view. Great beach (from Clifton 1 to 4) to relax and take in the splendour of one of the best beaches Cape Town has to offer. Sandy beaches backed by the Table Mountain range, very few beaches can compete in terms of beauty.

One of th best beaches I've seen. Very nice beach, not very crowded in January, I had great relaxing time. It has 4 parts, Clifotn 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th. You can either get there by buying the daily Red bus City Sightseeing ticket and just stop at the beach for 3-4 hours, then jump back to the bus. The othe roption is to ask one of those small minivans if they drive to Clifton. There is also official bus Golden Arrow, but it doesn't go very often.
Glamour beach. Beautiful beach although its a pity about the cold water. Still a great place for a day in the sun or a fantastic sunset!
Gorgeous Beach. Great place to hang out and get some rays--atmosphere is lovely and sand is very soft.... We enjoyed being there very much!

Nicest beach in cape town. Cristal clear icy water and white sands are the ingredients of clifton beach to be reached by some steep stairs. Despite it is attracting crowds you still will be able to find some private spots to just lay down and enjoy
My favorite beach around Cape Town. This beach is really beautiful and the rock formation on and around the beach make for some great photo opportunities!
Stunning beaches. Beautiful white sand and aquamarine water. While Clifton is usually the place to see and be seen, if you explore, you can find some private spots too.
Secret tip!. Best beach in cape town, not that crowded and truely beautiful. However also not far to famous camps bay
Fantastic. A marvellous beach. Water is icy even for European standards (not counting great whites...) but if the weather's good you must spend a day bumming on this lovely beach!

a place for the young and beautiful. 4 nice little beaches that you reach by climbing down lots of stairs from Beach Road, great white sand, gorgeous people to look at in case you adore the handsome ones, either gay or model type people depending on where you are going - my favorite was Clifton III

Nice, a little Miami Beach. Really cool and relaxed atmosphere, the rich side of Cape Town, but nice to walk the strip and sit at the beach or on a boulder, water is cold, but the views are awesome, the backdrop is table mountain!
Fun for a Sundowner. Likes: Beautiful beach; Fun to enjoy a sundowner (happy hour beverage) and a walk. Dislikes: Parking can be a challenge and not really a place to spend an entire day.
beautiful. Views stunning. Too cold to swim at though. Soft silky white sand. Beautiful sun trap. Lots of beautiful people
4 beach great for family. Gp to 4 beach with the family, water cold but great beach, walk to 1 and back for a vibe

Cold water. The water is cold, but the waterfront is buzzing and alive with clubs, pubs and restaurants. Not the cheap ones, but they are good ones. Nice for a splash out evening, and to enjoy a sunset on the beach!

One of the best spots for sundowners in Cape Town. Clifton's four beaches are quite simply some of our most magical beaches. We love going down there to people watch and to sun tan - swimming is only for the brave as it is freezing! We visit these beaches mostly to watch the sun set - the Cape Townian favourite thing in summer is to do "sundowners". We pack a picnic - text the friends to join us and head down to have supper and watch the sun set. Try it - it is great fun! Our favourite is 3rd beach for the sundowners. Pack some candles as it is quite magical to do a circle of light around you once the sun sets!

Clifton: Hot and Cold. Hot guys and girls, freezing cold water. I like 3rd for the gay scene, 4th for the sexiest straight scene next to the beaches of LA. The steps up and down are a killer, but its preferable to Camps Bay beach for the eye candy...
great beach. great beach with lots of good restaurants nearby! fun for a date night!
incredible. There are few places in the world - monaco comes to mind where you can drive alaong the edge of the ocean on the west coast. It is stunning.
beauty at its best. Beautiful beach - very busy over weekends - just beautiful!

Best beach in Cape Town!. You cannot have it better: snow white sand, incredible water colors and good people. We all know that the water is boiling cold in Cape Town, but maybe some hot bikinis can warm you up. The easiest is the access to Clifton 4 with 2 parking areas very close.Excellent beach !

Expensive real estate!. Rain or shine, you'll see Clifton Beach if you take the big red hop-on hop-off tour bus in Cape Town. Clifton, an affluent suburb, is home to some of the most expensive real estate in South Africa. The view there of the Twelve Apostles Mountains and the Atlantic Ocean is breathtaking and memorable.
Interesting.. Not spectacular, but interesting. The walking paths were easy to follow and well maintained.
Nice Beach not busy,. If get chance spend some time Great!, open sand, Bring your deck chair
Perfect on Windy days. If the wind is howling in Cape Town, 4th beach is usually sheltered and provides the best option. Parking can be tricky in summer if you getting down after 11am.

Awesome!. Meeting place of the world. Excellent reataurants and cafe's, beautiful white beach, adorned by stunning, bikini clad, sun-worshipping bodies. The wide-stretched ocean and overall breathtaking picture of nature
what a spot. a wonderful trip to the beach on a rainy day included visiting the cafes lining the streets and walking along the waterfront. fantastic view.

Summer easily one of the best beaches in the world. Dislike the crowds and no parking. Dislike the freezing cold water.
LOVE the beach, LOVE the ocean!
Five star beaches. Four pristine beaches in a row, and protected from the Cape wind. Clifton is best for bat and balls, sun tanning, sunset and picnics.

Best backdrop in the world. Definitely one of the most beautiful beaches in the world, offering 4 different beaches numbered 1, 2, 3 and 4, each with it's own unique crowd. The backdrop of the Table Mountain range and lion's head and the amazing villas on the mountainside provide in my opinion the most beautiful urban yet natural bacxkdrop for this powdery white sand beach with turqoise waters... the only thing is the water temp - but quite refreshing!

See and be seen. With the addition of the recently grounded fishing trawler, this is a lovely beach to visit (not to swim unless you are a polar bear!). Great white sand and azure sea with surrounding bars and coffee shops - try it!

Beach closed. Clifton Beach was closed when I visited as a ship had runaground onto the sands and it took almost a week for it to be towed off only once stormy seas arrived and a very high tide - the beach area looked beautiful though

Fantastic!. I have spent many a summers day at these beaches and they are by far my favorites! Late in the evening it is great to just sit and relax with a glass of wine and look out over the ocean, the sunsets are amazing! During the day the beach is packed and you meet many new people as everyone is always friendly and having a good time. Right across the road there are plenty of little shops and places to eat, so all in all a great day from sunrise to sunset.
Very beautiful white sands.... Some of the best white sands that I have ever visited. The beach could do with a bit more of maintenance I believe. Not to miss..

Best beach ever. Clifton beaches are definitely awesome beaches. I spend alot of my time there in summer. The water is freezing cold but the atmosphere in summer is the best. You meet so many friendly people and you can enjoy a lovely tan without being interrupted.
Tips:
pack yourself some snacks
pack your sunblock
Don't leave your valuables unattended
Beautiful Beaches and water. The best of Cape Towns beaches, that and Muizenberg. Althopugh if you looking for Some nice waves visit the Blouberg Strand area

Beautiful beach, nice suburb....so what....... Clifton Beach is THE place to live in Cape Town. Hugely expensive real estate, nice little shops and restaurants. The beach is small and kelpy, but the sand is white and the water clear (and freezing cold and shark-ridden).We were told that some of the real estate hear is over 100 million rand. Hmm....can't see the value myself. Give me Sydney harbour any day!Its a nice place to stop for brunch on a weekend though. Worth a look.
Absolutely devine. What a beautiful place to visit! Breathtaking views . Packed during summer.
Paradise. A great beach to escape on and awesome sunsets. Take a pullover this time of year but it is great.
comfortable. The beach is nice and flat for walks,with rocky areas where it was lovely to sit and look out over the ocean,but right across the street are wonderful restaurants
best beach in town. Clifton 4 is the best beach in Capetown. The people are so chilled and relaxed.
Overrated. The water is extremely cold. I have been to far better beaches. Protected from the wind, though and if you are not going to deep into the water, great place to suntan
white sands, emerald blue sea. This is too, too beautiful. And apart from weekends, when it gets so crowded, a place to relax, unwind.

very overrated. Geographically it is an amazing place, beach with huge granite boulders scattered on white sand at the bottom of the mountain. However, it's usually full of drunks, beggars, thieves and blaring radios. Go to Llandudno or Oudekraal to enjoy a beach.

The Pearl Of The Cape. One of the best beach's in the world.
Say no more it has it all snow white sand cristal clear water and beautiful ladys.
White sand. but the water is cold! Take an ordinary bus - Yellow Arrow - and it'll cost you 10 Rand. A taxi will take you for 140.
Lovely. One of the best beaches in Cape Town! Very clear water, but very cold!
Stunning beach. title pretty much says it all - soft sand, great scenery - what more do you want?
Best beach. great beach, especially number 4, parking close by and windless!

best beach i have ever been to. this is hands down the best beach i have ever been to in my 31 years of life. the sand is so clean, the views are stunning.very scenic sunsets to be had here. there is a bar nearby that sell sundowners. i recommend that you have a sundowner and watch the sunset.one of my best memories of my trip to SA is sitting watching the sunset at clifton beach.
Beach suburb. Ritzy area close to town centre with sand beaches for sun bathing but not recommended for swimming - cold water and sharks!
Wow. Spent a couple of days on the beach with the beautiful people
Clifton experience. Clifton Beach was clean and well kept. Water too cold to swim but a pleasant walk along the beach

Very cold water!. This is very pretty in the late afternoon but not exactly for swimming. Find a cafe overlooking the sea for a most wonderful sunset! The cocktails are expensive but so what. This is a once in a life time dream.
paradys. The view from the top,great just great,people are wonderfull and so are the beach.

Beautiful place to enjoy the sun. Clifton Beach 1,2,3&4 are small beaches between bantry bay and camps bay beach. They are separated by huge rocks and they are very nice and fancy :)and always clean. Beautiful expensive houses with amazing swimming pools on their balconies are built here and I don't know what looks better: the ocean, the beaches or the houses behind :) a nice and calm place to enjoy your sunny days in cape town. And there are always people who sell drinks and ice cream, but if you want to spend less money , buy everything that you need (food and drinks) in some local stores.

Just the best !. For me Clifton Beach is definitely the best beach in Cape Town !! Because It is the most sheltered beach that I have been to , making it pleasant to relax on your towel and swim (though be warned the sea can be a bit cold !!) Try to get to Moonstruck on Clifton it will have the nicest crowd and a great vibe !!
Pleasant beach. A very quiet and pleasant beach, although Sunday nights can be very lively!
One of the best beach in Cape Town. because there is no a lot of people.. but the water is really cold

My favourite spot in Cape Town. There's nothing quite like Clifton Beach. An absolutely stunning spot that would be overrun with tourists and locals anywhere else in the world. The water is freezing but so worth it. An absolute must.

A quiet gem in Cape Town. This is a quiet beach if you visit outside of peak times and want to enjoy the sunset. There are a series of interlinked beaches and it's easy to move between them at low tide, or scramble over the rocks at high tide. Subtle differences in the views and varying levels of privacy make it worth the effort. The water is cold and better for a barefoot walk than a proper swim.
Gorgeous. Beautiful beach and plenty of great restaurants to visit. I would highly recommend La Mouette.

A dip of the feet.. Lovely to drive along the coast and stop and start when and where and view the sights. Paddle in the water and take in the fabulous views. Turquoise waters and white sandy beaches.

Great for sunbathing ..... Great place to top up the tan. Sunbeds available for hire, sand is like powder. Water is freezing though but very refreshing. Feels abit like being in the med but with soft sand ... definately will recommend.
The famous beach of Cape Town. Sydney has Bondi, whilst Cape Town has Clifton. There are 4 distinct beaches here separated by rocks. 4th beach is the best but the water can be chilly
Beautiful beach. Love it safe sea and plenty of locals sell drinks but I would advise to take a picnic there are plenty of steps to climb
Wonderful views. We are not beach people but the views were excellent
Popular but!. Parking a problem during the holiday season and at weekends. Water cold!
Magnificent Beach. The water is cold but everything else is hot. Where celebs live and vacation
Beautiful Blue Waters. Great place to hang out. Must try out the French Pancake guys which is a mobile cart onthe street. This guy makes great french pancakes

One of the highlights of the Cape. perfect, sheltered beaches. Parking on the main road a bit of a problem, but it is worth the effort. Our very own Portofino in Cape Town! Best real estate in Africa!

THE BEST BEACH IN THE WORLD. Clifton is one of the best beaches in the world and i have been to several. It consists of 4 beaches divided only by rocks. 4th beach is mainly a family beach whilst 1st beach is mainly for young singles. The walk to the beach is down stairs and parking can be difficult. On a good day you need to get there at about 0930 or round lunch time when lots of families with young children are leaving. If its at other times, be prepared to park a long way away. It is protected from the S. Easter and is a long white sandy beach with no shells. THe water is cold but on a windless day the best place to be.

Turquoise waters. Clifton Beach is stunning for a day out in Cape Town. The Southeasterly wind often blows in the city, and this beach is one of the only protected areas where you can go to find refuge from the howling wind in summer. Bring your umbrella because there is no shade, and be prepared for VERY chilly waters - a nice refreshing break from a hot sunny day.
Can see on the red bus tour. If you are short of time, you can view the beaches when doing the red bus tour!

wow!. I hung out here for a couple of days. Beautiful white sandy beach, plenty of nice restaurants, you can hire loungers, there are toilets and showers. Great to soak up the sun on a beach so close to central Cape Town. Only thing is the sea was too freezing to get in! Highly recommend.
A safe and enjoyable environment with something for everyone. We spent of days, on and off, in the wharf area. Plenty to do and see with some great eateries and bars

Good carparking. plenty of car parking space, lots of steps to get to the beach, so no good if with some one elderly or infirm. Annoying beach sellers that constantly bother you to buy drinks/ice creams etc. Good facilities, shower/toilets. VERY COLD sea!!!
Wannabes. Over-rated, usually crowded and full of wanna-bes. Better beaches, nicer places to be found around Cape Town.
Aview to die for.. Only the most expensive place to live but the houses and views are to die for. Great nightly entertainment and beach site.
Powdery sand. Clifton Beaches are very peaceful and sandy. I couln't work out if you could hire sun umbrellas here - a must for me in January.
Beautiful beautiful beautiful. Not much more to say, don't forget your sunscreen!
Just beaufitul. Beautiful beach protected from wind with the most amazing sunsets

Great sunsets. Clifton beach is a must-be place in Cape Town at the end of the day. The main road is filled with restaurants and bars and offers great sunset views over the Atlantic Ocean. Note however that these restaurants are not for the budget traveller. If you are on a budget, rather have a sundowner (a drink or 2) during sunset and then move to the city for dinner.
Best beach in Cape Town. This is the best beach in Cape Town, if you want to be seen then go here. You might bump into someone you know.
Fun filled leisure day. The beach is a perfect postcard picture, vibrant with a cosmopolitan buzz in summer, sorry about parking in the area.
Pristine beach. Lovely beach that is maintained and safe. Very popular amongst locals and tourists. Best part is that accross the street is a whole variety of posh restaurants and coctail bars.

clfiton explained. If you didn't know, in general terms, although all are welcome:
1 each is popular with surfers
2nd beach with students often and beach games
3rd beach is the gay beach
4th beach is probably the most popular with the well healed crowd; it sthe glamour beach
Beautiful beach!. Stunning view - blue sea and white sand. Very cold if you want to swim though! It's a small beach so not good if you want to do long walks.

There are 4 Clifton beaches. These are well worth visiting, especially when the South Easter is blowing! An interesting climb down some stairs, but worth it. Beware though the water can be bracingly cold!
another wonderful place to spend time. wonderful place for the beach lovers. So many wonderful Capetown Beaches and this one will not disappoint.
Excellent Beach. Great beach with great waves and sand in a lovely bay. There is limited facilities but it is close to camps bay if you want to each lunch. This was our favourite beach.
Best beach. I love clifton 4th. Very small and gets crowded but the weather is always nice there (wind free) and the water seems warmer. Also easier to swim :)

Best Beach. This Blue Flag beach is actually 4 beached numbered 1 to 4, each beach separated by rocks. One of the most beautiful beaches and probably the most popular beach in Cape Town. The water is freezing and the stairs to get down can take effort but its worth it.

One of the best beaches in the world!. If your a beach bum - this is the place for you! A spectacular beach, with magnificient views of mountains and sea, beautiful people, and loads of sunshine, wind free - this is the place for you! This beach can stand with sme of the best beaches in the world!
Super beach.. Like all the beaches along this bit of coast it is clean, good for sunbathing and has a good choice of places to eat.

Sexiest beach award. These beaches are lovely. not huge, but they have a magic about them. Each beach has a different clientel - for example beach 4 is family oriented, 3 is muscle mary gay guys, 2 is a straight trendy crowd... Parking here is HELL. We stay in a great house above 2nd beach. Avoid Christmas - its way too busy.

Best Beach in the World hands Down. I;d like someone to tell me a better beach than Clifton. The people, the view of the mountains behind you. It doesn't get much better than this- well maybe heat up the water by a few degrees but even that is fun and gives it character.
The Cape Riviera. Go see for yourself! Its spectacular! You would want to own a piece of this.
Beautiful seaviews. Beautiful white beach and nice to go to when south easter is blowing

Trendy tanners abound. Sheltered and scenic, Clifton is crowded in summer, making parking difficult to find. But it's worth a walk, because once you're there, it's pretty laid-back. You have a choice of four beaches, numbered 1 to 4 from the city end. The population varies from season to season, but a constant is that 4th, the largest of the beaches, attracts families and ball games, whereas 3rd, the cosiest, attracts lots of gay men in Speedos. The general ethos is pretty exhibitionistic, but there's space for everybody, and lots of little coves if you don't fancy the meat market. The water is too cold for all but the hardiest to swim in, but it certainly is refreshing. Lovely at sunset when the crowds have dispersed somewhat.
nice. this is a wonderful spot for watching the beautiful young ladies of Cape Town
Best Views. There are few beaches in the world which are as beautiful as Clifton beach!! The view cannot be beaten!

Nice place to spend a few hours. Nice clean beach - not too busy and with really nice helpful guys selling ice creams etc - not the cheapest, but just trying to make an honest living so do try and put some money their way!Water was super cold, but we did see some amazing shoals of sardines and sealions feeding on them.

Nice and relaxing beach. Very nice and local beach!
If you're looking for nice bars and restaurants this is not the place to be though. Perfect for a lazy beach day!
Simply amazing. You have to go and visit Clifton beach while you are in Cape Town. We had no idea that the beaches were this amazing in Cape Town, Lots of great little bars and restaurants.

Enjoy a Mediteranean experience in Africa :). Clifton is one of Cape Town's trendiest beaches. While the wind blasts everywere else, there will not be a 0.5 knot in this place. The only trouble is that the water is cold yet refreshing.
Beautiful beach, beautiful views & Beautiful people. An absolute must for any leisure traveller in CT! You have to see the beaches and the people as they frolic and parade as peacocks!

It was okay. I have visited Clifton Beach many times, I like 4th beach.Lovely sand, sea very cold. On this day again beautiful weather, chairs and umbrellas avalable, was very crowded, I was not too happy as I had a group of about 20 decided to play a rough rugby game right in front of us, it got a bit loud.I don't mind fun and games on a beach but 20 all at once is a bit much .We left.
See and be seen. This a great beach, generally very sheltered from the wind.
mind the steep stairs to the beach!!!. It is a nice beach but be warned you have like a million steps down to get to them form the street. I preferred Camps Bay beaches that are at street level.

Cold water, tanners only.. Take your beautiful body to show off at Clifton. The water is horrendously cold (Atlantic) so I would not go in. The sand is nice, and maybe your toes will forgive you if you dip them in. Try Gordon's Bay or Muizenberg for the swimming experience.
Great beach. Great big beach but parking and traffic a nightmare. Plenty of nice restaurants. There is a sports field half way down the street on left where you can park which is very cheap.

Great Beach, No Social Scene. The beach is probably one of the best. The locals come in hoards on a hot day. If you are looking though for a combination of beach and social scene then you best head to Camp's Bay. If you are just looking for the best beach than this is it!

My favourite Cape Town beach. It's in the suburb of Clifton, next to Camps Bay. Originally the houses were old bungalows but have evolved into grander places. But even some of the two bedroom places start at over 1.5 million dollars each. There are 4 beaches, with 4th being the easiest to get to, and my go to one. There's a pretty full car park with limited parking. From there you have to walk down steep steps, carrying your stuff. The beach is a beautiful, powdery one. But the water can be , to put it mildly, refreshing. There are bed and umbrella rentals available along with paddle boards. On the day we were there and through summer there was a promo where bodyboards and bat n ball were being let out for free. There are ice cream sellers with their uniquely Cape Town patois; Lolly make you jolly etc. Amusing though tooooo frequent.A great place to see and be seen and definitely hear. You can hear half of Johannesburg on the beach using their cell phones to contact the half left behind. And loudly.

Best beaches in CT. Serious of beache coves.. 4th beach for familys, best to go to first beach as quieter. At peak times, you may need to park on high level rd adn walk down hundreds of steps but well worth the effort. In mid summer - best to get there around 3pm and sunsets around 8 !

Great beach. We spent a day on Clifton 3. It's known as a gay beach, although I'd estimate less than a third of the people on there fitted into that category. We went mainly because we figured there would be less kids there (there were still a couple). The beaches here get busy because unlike Camps Bay they are sheltered from the wind. Sun loungers cost 50 rand to hire and parasols 30. The loungers have seen better days.People walk up and down selling drinks and ice creams. Someone seemed to walk past at least every 2 minutes.I walked over to Clifton 4 to use the toilet (as there aren't any on the 3rd beach). This is a much bigger beach with a lot more people, a couple of bars, people playing ball games etc.

Lovely at night. Forget about swimming in the beaches here - it is freezing. But the vibe and atmosphere reminds one of L.A! The palce to see and be seen - and spend some time having an evening campout on one of the beaches - fantastic.
Clifton 4th beach is the perfect sun loving place to hang out. Easy access, toilets. and drink vendors close by but busy

Acquire the perfect tan at Clifton. And it will be so easy. Gorgeous beaches, comprising of 4 beaches seperated by boulders. If you have worked out and wanna show off your toned body this is where the pretty people of South Africa hand out. Enjoy!

lovely. Clifton is made up of 4 beaches (1st, 2nd 3rd and 4th beach), with 4th beach being the most popular. The beach is protected against the wind, and is beautiful. As with most beaches around Cape Town, the water is usually very cold for swimming, but sometimes it can surprise you and be perfect!

Perfect for sunbathing. Clifton fourth has sunbeds, umbrellas, clean sand, toilets, showers, and a host of cheerful drinks vendors. Alas, the sea is cold, but then Clifton is not really about swimming!

Chic beach. Clifton is definetely the place to go if you want to see some gorgeous people in a very beautiful environment. Although the water is freezing, it's worth to stay at least one day on the beach. After a long day by the sun, have a drink at "The Bungalow" on the way to Glenn Beach.

Disappointing. People flock here because it is partly protected from the strong Atlantic wind. When we went it was completely packed. No cafes, no bars, no sun beds to hire ... you can get a cold (ish) drink at the odd tent on beach 4Camps Bay is a much nicer place and just down the coast - the only drawback is that Camps does get more windSo maybe get your sun at Clifton and then move to Camps Bay for a drink
Beautiful white sand!. This beach was sheltered from the wind a bit more than Camps Bay Beach. Water was still very cold this time of year. Wish we had more time to spend on this beach!!!
Gorgeous beaches. Beautiful beaches along the Atlantic seaboard. The water is like ice. Spectacular views all along the drive.

Sunset special!. Liked: Love the late afternoon views from Clifton beach - of the sea, and surrounding mountains.
Dislike: Parking is often a bit of a mission, as one would expect when trying to squash in between a mountain and the sea...

A really nice beach and close to the city. Clifton beach actually comprises four beaches and the one I visited, Clifton 4 is the largest and widest - apart from Sea Point, Clifton is the closest beach to the city.Car parking is nearby- across the road and also on the road down to the beach - manned by car guards for a payment of about R10 - well worth it. The beach is accessed by steps - quite a climb getting back up. However it is a really nice beach - lovely white sand, with a cafe and toilets and a lovely place to spend an afternoon. Walkable distance from Camps Bay beach.

Must Spend Saturday Evening at Clifton Beach. I spent my last Saturday evening in Cape Town at Clifton Beach. Simply enjoyable and beautiful. To all Cape Town Visitors: Go have a glass of wine at one of the many restaurants at Clifton Beach and watch the sun set.
protected. clifton was the most protected beach of all from the wind. Clifton 3rd is smaller and nicer than 4th beach which can get packed and sometimes with a bit of an unsavoury element
Great beach. Very popular white sandy beaches which are sheltered from the wind.
Gorgeous beach. Very pretty, quiet beach - toilets but no cafes or bars near by.
wonderful beach. one of the nicest beaches around cape town, but the water temperature is brrrrrrrr!

Lovely Place to Chill. We were staying on Kloof road and walked down to the beach. There are loads of stairs that you can walk down to get to the beach. I think there could have been about 300 to 500 steps to walk down to get to the beach. It was great exercise. The beaches were very clean, although the water was freezing in November. Every time i stepped in the water, my foot went into an immediate cramp because the water was freezing. The first 3 beaches were private, one even had a seal lying on one of the rocks. The fourth beach has a vibe and when we were there a junior life saver training session was happening. Very cool to see. On fourth beach there were very clean and well equipped change rooms/ toilets which was handy.The beach is walking distance from Camps bay and Le Med which was closed for renovations when we were there.

Best Beach In Cape Town. Being Capetonian, I've been to all the beaches in Cape Town - Clifton is by far the beach of choice.
Grab your sunscreen, umbrella, beach chairs, some snacks, and come on down
Happy Days. No visit to the beach is better than Clifton I love fourth beach the best its clean and fun. People watching is a must and don't forget plenty of suncream
Pass through. Ffilled with tower block hotels, a good route out of Cape Town towards Caps Bay and further onto the Peninsula purely for the sea view
Luxury and Beauty. There is a lot of beautiful people on the scenic beaches in Clifton. It feels like a tropical paradise
Gorgeous beach. This is a must see on any trip to Cape Town. One of the loveliest beaches in the world - the reviews are for real. Take off your shoes and go in the water.

Where the rich and beautiful get tanned. Check out Cliffton Beach, or let me say the Cliffton Beaches... there are 4 of them and each one is different. They are all beautiful with clear water and amazing sand, but people are completely different. One is occupied by families with children at all ages, one is for elderly people, one is covered with "the most beautiful" people in Cape Town and one is held by the gay community. So each and everyone can easily find their perfect spot... Enjoy!!
Awsome. 3rd beach is best, very mixed and not so many irritating children and families!
